column7: I have had kidney stones practically my entire adult life, producing one every 4 to 6 months. 3 years ago my pattern changed tho. It switched from my left kidney to my right and after it switched sides, I only produced a single stone the first time then the pain of passing a stone was occurring every few weeks. After a while I would produce bloody urine frequently and I finally got a CT scan to confirm what I feared. a 2cm stone was in my right kidney. The nephrologist said "your kidney is functioning in normal levels" so they didn't suggest doing anything about it and I'm seriously dumbfounded, because of the amount of pain I was in. Pain makes us think differently, My next step was to figure out a way to make a DIY lithotripsy machine. Luckily I found the stonebreaker chanca piedra. Within a month I was back to feeling normal and I decided to take a bottle's worth of 1 pill a day as maintenance. I ran out and felt fine so I didn't get a new bottle. 1 year later, I bought another bottle as I passed a small stone. This stuff truly is amazing. It works at least for the uric acid based stones which is what I produced. TL;DR It works and I am kicking myself for not continuing my maintenance of a pill a day for a year.

column7: I am a full time sick person and natural skeptic of EVERY so-called "instant cure" and non-med treatment for illnesses. (If I had a dollar for every time someone told me to try yoga for one of my lifelong illnesses, I would have enough money to retire at 32.) However, I also recently added kidney stones to my long list of ailments - they run in my family - and a friend who also suffers INSTANTLY told me to grab this stuff. After weeks of gritting my teeth through the pain and only passing sediment, I gave in and ordered. I took two a day for a week. And then I painlessly passed a stone. WHAT. SERIOUSLY? WHAT??? I've had one flare-up of kidney pain since, took another week course of two pills a day, and passed a bunch of crumbly bits. I'm a believer now. This is one of the very few times I will admit that there IS a non-medication solution to dealing with kidney crap, and this is it.

column7: I suffer from a kidney stone disorder called MSK and for years I've looked for something, anything, that could help break down the stones and help them pass easier. I've altered my diet, take suppliments and drink enough water to fill a swimming pool but nothing seemed to help me as much as Chanca Piedra. I happened to stumble upon an article about it and thought I'd give it a try. After going through a few different, pricier, brands I finally found the Alerna brand. This is straight Chanca Piedra. No mixes, no fillers nothing extra to get in the way or give the manufacturer an excuse to charge a ridiculous made up price for something that doesn't work. I've been taking it now for a few months and have noticed a distinct difference in my kidney stone output as well as the way my body handles dealing with a passing stone. They nickname this stuff the "stonecrusher" and from what I've seen the shoe fits. Imagine going to the restroom to urinate and peeing out what appears to be a powdered version of what you normally contend with. For the first time cloudy urine didn't mean I had a UTI. It meant my body was flushing out pulverized kidney stone! If you deal with kidney stones at all I believe this product may be beneficial for you. And for the price it's way more affordable then multiple costly trips to the urologist only to be told, "It looks like you have a kidney stone." Brilliant!

column7: Ill be the first to admit i never put any creedance in reviews. ( i know for a fact glowing reviews can be bought ) ...but not THIS MANY! 7000+ and growing?! My story: Im a life long 30+ year diet soda drinker. hardcore...gallon a day easy... i always knew "the day" was gonna come...well, last week i got a warning shot. i was sitting completely still and WHAM! a sharp stab hit me in my lower right back side right above the beltline...."what the hell was that?"... i freaked... cut to 5 minutes later im in sheer panic as its not letting up... i told my son GET TO WALLYWORLD NOW and get a heating pad! for those of you that can relate it felt like a muscle spasm...but not...well the cut to the chase was this...i have no medical insurance and frankly im one of "those people" who is not about to set foot in a dr's office , especially these days. i needed a solution FAST. so a friend of mine whos been through this said "yep, kidney stones... " then starts listing off all the fun im about to have.... Oh, GREEEEAT! as i awaited my sons return i took my friends additional advice and ordered 2 bottles of STONE BREAKER...my son arrived back with the heating pad and it helped... a LOT...seriously... all of you reading this, try it. you will thank me during flair ups. it cuts them WAY down. amazon delivered 2 LONG days later and i started taking them religiously....heres the results: Day 1 - cut pain down 20-30% - pills + heating pad cut flair ups overall time and frequency by 20%. 1 week - pain down 75% and i can sleep at night without being awakened by night 5. 2nd week - Nothing! no pain at all. interestingly i never passed anything ... ( i was checking ) i will continue with this until bottle is used up so my story may differ from yours but as for my opinion, i have never been so impressed with a OTC product in my life. THANK YOU STONE BREAKER you saved me from a hospital bill i could never pay!

column7: So, I was feeling the onset of a kidney stone for two days and came across "Stone Breaker". I thought, after reading many reviews, that I would give this a try. After receiving them, I followed the instructions, and after two days of taking this product, I had NO signs / symptoms of kidney stones aggravating my left kidney. I have not had any relapse since then, and that's been about six weeks ago. I don't know for sure if these did what they're stated to do, but I have no other way to give credit for my stones going away. With that said, I believe they worked and will have some left over incase I have another episode...of which I am prone to have. I'll follow up with this review if I have to take them again.

I wish I'd heard about this amazing product years ago. I just spent over a month in the hospital and a nursing home over a .50 calibre kidney stone which damaged my one functioning kidney, causing me to develop Septicemia. I was in a coma for 2 weeks, and almost died. They put 2 Stents in me, a painful and uncomfortable process, and used sonics twice to try and break the stone up went thru the Stent and sonics once before in 2018 on a smaller stone. I put lemon juice in all my drinks every day to deal with these stones, and have passed many smaller stones since then. My 1st Dt said my body socks every nutrient out of my food, and it stores them in my body. I have calcium deposits in my heart too. He thinks it's a survival trait designed for ancient times when food was scarce and hard to come by. But in the modern world of convenience food, it's causing me grief. I thought his theory was goofy until several years later, I had to undergo multiple hip replacement surgeries and my orthopedic surgeon told me I had the thickest bones he ever saw. "Like a gorilla"s, he said. My orthopedic problems are caused from me being extremely double jointed. I develop them quickly whenever I get lax and don't consume enough of the lemon juice ( due to not being able to find it in stores. I live in a very rural area with limited supply options). Anyway, I never heard of Stone Breaker until this latest bout of kidney stone misery. They call them stones, but they look and feel like shards of broken glass, especially when you pass them. It starts with an extreme pain in your lower back. Like you've been run thru with a spear. Then, over the course of several hours you can feel the stone fragment moving up and over your hip bone and down into your groin area. If you've suffered them before, the pain is so incredible you're afraid to pee! The first time I passed one, the ordeal was so awful that I gripped the door frame so hard in the bathroom, that I damaged the wood and indented it! (Now, I grip the handle of my heavy duty metal cane). When the stones come out (thank God!!!) You can hear them hitting the sides of your toilet bowl or urinal jug. What a miserable ordeal of agony! Anyway, last week after having the 3rd Stent put in me, I found out about Stone Breaker and upon reading the testimonials I ordered it. Upon arrival I took it. The very next day after taking it I began to pass more stones, albeit they were much smaller and smoother, and nowhere near as painful as stones I had passed before. Stone Breaker really seems to work, just as other victims of this terrible affliction have attested. I can vouch for it too! Oh if only I had known about it earlier, perhaps I could have saved myself a ton of misery, time and a mountain of medical bills. JD Cbarles

column7: I was diagnosed in March 2019 with gastritis (inflammation of the stomach lining). The doctors did a CT scan and another different scan but found nothing wrong with anything else. While this is probably a common issue I realized early in my journey to recovery that digestive issues start with the gallbladder and liver. I did not want to continue on the Proton Pump Inhibitors that the doctor prescribed to alleviate the acid buildup in my stomach (it made me feel more bloated). The only way to rid the pain and bloat was celery juice in the morning, intermittent fasting and 40 minute workouts twice a day (I also changed my diet). While this worked through 2019 and 2020, I know I wasn't always going to have access to cardio equipment every day. Covid hit 2020 so fast forward to August 2021 and I started feeling that weird pressure over my gallbladder again. I was able to rid the pain but not the pressure. I came across this product while searching Amazon for supplements and read the reviews. The majority of people had great outcomes so I bought a bottle. I've only taken one a day so far but it has been really fast acting right away, reduced the pressure under my right ribs quickly. I take one with my morning meal with a Calcium, Magnesium Zinc tablet. One NAC tablet, B12, Vit D3 with 1 capsule each of Milk Thistle (liver support) and lecithin. I would also drink Roasted Dandelion Root Tea for my digestion. I was taking the vitamins and supplements before the Stonebreaker capsule was added in recently. This combo really helped a lot. But one thing I noticed, the Stonebreaker addition makes you go do #2 ALOT IN quantity in the beginning. I'm assuming it's cleaning out your backed up system and helping bile move from liver to gallbladder for fatty breakdown. I recently gave one capsule to my sister (has diabetes) to see if it would help her although she is so skinny I don't know if she had anything to get rid of internally. SURPRISE! She said it really cleaned out her colon. UPDATE 12/3/21 I gave a capsule to my cousin as she was having trouble going to the bathroom to urinate several times a night and felt like she was still full right after she would go. We thought it would help her kidneys. She took only one and 3 days later went to the emergency room with excruciating pain from a dislodged kidney stone. We kind of assumed it was dislodged by the Chanca Piedra preventing the formation of stones and since the stone wasn't growing larger it broke down and was able to travel to her bladder. She kept drinking lemon water and celery juice for a week after and hasn't felt any pain since then in November. Although she was freaked out by the kidney pain when it happened she since doesn't want to take the Stone Breaker at all. But I will keep taking it as my pain has subsided to nothing. UPDATE 2 My cousin decided to continue taking it and increased her water intake and drinking specific teas for kidney support. Seems to be working.

column7: I'm not one who typically writes reviews (Although I should help others make buying decisions), but I'm so happy with the results from this product that I felt compelled to write this review. You see, this is my very first experience with kidney stones, which I discovered after going to the emergency with excruciating pain. The emergency room visit was on a Friday morning. Although the Dr. prescribed Norco (pain killer), I only took it once and then got on ibuprofen. As I'm not the type of person that likes to take any painkiller or drug, I had to find a better solution. So I found Stone Breaker Chanca Piedra on Monday and had it delivered by Tuesday noon. I immediately took two capsules as recommended. Miraculously by 7:30 pm, I began passing the stone in small tiny fragments. No pain at all. So personally, for me, the bottom line is that this product worked. I am taking two capsules in the morning and two at night as recommended to keep the kidneys healthy. I hope this review helps you if you are experiencing the pain that comes along with kidney stones.

column7: I cant be 100% sure that these did the trick but I would tell anyone suffering from kidney stones to get this stuff right away. I'm prone to kidney stones and have had quite a few over a 10 year span but this last one was an 11 MM calcium & uric acid stone in my left kidney found during an xray. After months of off and on pain I purchased a bottle of stone breaker and took about 3/day with lemon water and flo-max. The Dr. said it was stuck at the bladder ureter and there was no way I would pass this monster so I scheduled lithotripsy for the end of the month. I could tell this stuff was working and that it was on its way out, sure enough the stone and some fragments came out (with some extreme pain though) With a stone this size I would recommend not trying to pass it on you own and get treatment but I would imagine this product would do wonders for keeping stones from forming and or growing too large to pass. Always go to your DR. for treatment and if I had to do this again I would take the surgery but in this case, this little jar helped me save about $6,500 in a co-pay for that treatment. I will be a customer for life now...

column7: Figured I’d share my sob story and contribute since so many others did and I valued their feedback in a desperate time, so I hope someone can benefit off of my story as well. After weeks of antibiotics and a negative urine culture, doctors thought I had a bad bladder infection, turns out my ultrasound showed two stones (unsure of size) in my bladder. So all of that stabbing back pain for weeks was me passing the stones from my kidneys to my bladder. After panicking a bit my integrative doctor recommended chanca piedra and after reading reviews of this and such a success stories I had to try! After 3-4 days of taking the pills 2 pills in the am 2 pills at night along with lemon water and apple cider vinegar, and eliminating meat and salt, I started to feel the stone(s) travel south into my uterer. Definitely reached a point that last night where I knew it was go time… pains in my chest, couldn’t walk, shooting pains from my groin. I drew a bath and put on some peaceful music. Popped a half of a prescription pain pill my friend gave me and pushed. Next day pains subsided and the next and the next, but I thought I had one more left stuck in there, but recent kidney and bladder ultrasound shows no stones and I feel great! I’m now curbing my diet and taking extra precaution, but these things work! Be patient :)) hang in there. And also try to get a prescription pain pill because it made it tolerable and not so scary. Stay safe and healthy guys! All my best, C

column7: I was diagnosed with two kidney stones after a bevy of uncomfortable symptoms in February 2021. Following CT scan, found a 1.5mm and 2.5mm. I initially took 2 capsules per day as directed, but after one month, tapered down to 1 capsule a day as I wasn't having UTI-like symptoms anymore and it was more in hopes of preventing more stones/existing stones from growing. The symptoms I did have (frequent nocturia, UTI-like symptoms of burning and pain) resolved after less than a week of taking two capsules per day. September 2021, had another CT scan to find the 1.5mm stone vanished (I wasn't aware of passing anything, and I understand it can be excruciating) and the 2.5mm stone is now 3mm but the Hounsfield density decreased from 400-something to 300-something. Other habits I picked up included: 1. Drinking the juice of two fresh lemons every day 2. Avoiding all high oxalate foods (former keto dieter, unfortunately) 3. Ensuring I get enough dairy when I do eat moderately-high oxalate foods 4. Drinking 5+ liters of water a day depending on my activity level. I'm certainly not going to stop taking this supplement if there's even a 1% percent chance it helped get rid of the other stone and saved me the suffering of passing it. Here's to hoping the remaining stone will stop growing! All in all, highly recommend.

column7: THIS WORKS!! I was diagnosed with 4-5 mm kidney stone stuck in my ureter. This is my first time ever having a kidney stone. I prefer natural remedies so decided not to take the prescription. A few days later I had a kidney stone attack & was in so much pain, inflamed, flank pain, running to the toilet literally every 10 min for nothing but dribbles, slight nausea, & I could barely walk so stayed in bed all day. Long story short I made an anti-inflammatory juice shot (ginger root, apple, orange, lemon, tumeric powder, & black pepper). About 30 min later I started feeling better!! The pain, inflammation, & nausea subsided! I wad able to move around & cook dinner. I decided to try the chanca piedra to help in passing the stone. After 3 days of the juice shot 2x/day & the chanca piedra 3x/day my urinary retention cleared! I was no longer dribbling. I was determined to pass the stone naturally so I pushed my follow up appt out to 2 months & for those 2 months this was my daily remedy : 1.) drank 12-16 cups of water daily starting the morning off with 2 cups of warm lemon or lime water, 2.) chanca piedra 3x/ day, & 3.) a cup of ACV water (2 Tbsp unfiltered organic apple cider vinegar) 5x/day (*1 week on & 1 week off*). I also prayed to God that my stone would not only pass naturally but that it would dissolve so I wouldn’t feel it…and 2 months later I am excited to say my scan results came back clear!! The doctor was SO suprised that it passed! And I never felt any pain when it passed nor did I ever see it (and I checked every time). All glory to God!!

Was somewhat skeptical, but dig into independent reviews outside of Amazon, results seemed to be favorable. For me, had to pass a stone else face the unpleasant laser lithotripsy + stent + cystoscopy… After 3 months, with drinking gallon a day + Flomax, Stone had moved down near the bladder but never made it out. Urologist was concerned of permanent kidney damage due to the time in my system, prescheduled the procedure. With that hanging over my head, sought non-medical ways to deal with this as clearly the Flomax had already done its thing. After twice weekly sessions with an acupuncturist and the Chanca Piedra, Stone came out with just a small pinching pain in about 3 weeks. Wish I had took the holistic approach earlier, would have saved about $2K of consultation + imaging tests, not to mention the mental stress. Caveat - there is a place for western medicine- you need CT / Ultrasounds scans to visualize the stone, but herbal remedies seem to have much less side effects and more efficacy in actual treatment, when you supercharge your own body to fight ailments. That was the most important thing I’ve learned as a result of this experience. All the best to those that are dealing with the dreaded kidney stones.

I don't write a lot of reviews, but this merits one. In early March 2020, my wife went in for a lithotripsy for a couple of large stones. -Yes, I'm just getting around to writing the review- She was imaged about a week after and told that she'd have to return because there were a couple of fair-sized pieces remaining. The familiar pain started right after that- not as bad as the first, but it didn't look like fun. Problem was her urologist's practice shut down because of Covid, her only other option was the ER, and she didn't want to go yet. I researched and found this stuff, and after looking through the literature to make sure I wasn't poisoning her, I started her on it. I really didn't think much was going to happen, but wanted to try this before we did the ER shuffle once again. Since she was up and about despite the discomfort, she agreed. After 8 days of her using the toilet with the screen funnel she was given after the first litho, she passed the fragments. This stuff actually worked for her- she cleared all the fragments. Went through the literature again and found it's been used and studied, mostly in South American hospitals, with a reasonable number of good outcomes. From what I've read, it's supposed to change urine composition in such a way that smooths the crystaline spikes from the surface of stones, allowing them to pass easier.

So after being in Kidney pain and sick of paying for doctors doing invasive painful procedures. Which was once. Yes one stint is enough to last me a lifetime. I have not tested that or anything but I have family history of uric acid problems like gout. I passed two stones then received this product four days later. My right side had tightness and was affecting my job. Sitting and standing was very difficult as your ureter tries to push an obstruction. So I took about six pills and already could feel the stone shrink. Additionally I ate a box of Sweet Tarts(Malic acid) and walked 10k a day. It was painful but I could feel it move down. I think it even shrunk or broke them to a point of not feeling them exit or tearing pieces of flesh out. Highly recommend this if you have kidney stone pain. If you know what that is obviously. It is easy to take two in the morning and two at night. I have had a little bit of loose bowel as a possible side effect but that is a simple price to pay for relief and thousands of dollars in medical bills. Easy to swallow to and no taste at all.

I've suffered from kidney stones for about 15 years. In the beginning, i would get 1 every other year but the past 4 years, i get them like evey few months. Ive been to a urologist, been on potassium citrate, lowered my sodium, cut back on high oxalate foods, taken 24 hr urine tests.. And before taking this pill, the only thing that kinda helped was taking a good probiotic (there is research that shows that certain strains of probiotics will bind with oxalates and prevent them from binding with calcium to form a stone). I came across a different brand of chanca peidra back in october and took it for about a month (4 pills daily) but nothing passed (it is now april). Last year at a urologist check up and an ultrasound, i had a 6 mm stone in my right kidney and a 5mm stone on left side. So that's what led me to try chanca piedra last oct. Fast forward to first week of april, i started to feel mild back pain and i knew it was the stone moving (but this has been ongoing since feb 2020). So i decided to try this brand of chanca piedra. I received it on apr 14... Took 2 a day for about 5 days.. Then i stopped.. No reason why just forgot to keep taking it. And today is apr 24 and i passed the dark stone (see pic).. Now the only way for me to know for sure if it is the 5mm or 6mm stone is to have an ultrasound or ct or mri.. But I'm willing to bet that it is indeed the 6mm that was in my right side. For me, i believe these pills helped as i have been trying everything the urologist prescribed for over a year now with no results until this. I know that stones over 7mm require surgical intervention so I'm glad i didnt have to have it surgically removed (and I've had to have surgery for stone removal as well).

column6: Outside the country and the pain began...
column7: You know when you're in a different country that does not have English as the first language, things are going to get complicated when you go to a hospital. Everything is different...language, doctors, processes, labs etc. So, I had left the US for about a year and settled in nicely until one day the pain in my groin, back and stomach just rolled on in like an announced guest. No bueno. Went to the local Farmacia and grabbed some ibuprofen and it helped slightly. Two weeks later I'm still in pain, burning etc. and generally thinking I have an std. Ugh. Well, let's get it over with then right? Headed to the hospital and had the embarrassment of telling them the dreaded statement..."it burns when I pee". Yea, good times. They make me wait an hour or so and then send me to the lab. They take the blood work and send me over to the Urologist. Of course by now I'm dreading the results and then the doc looks up from the paperwork and says everything looks pretty good. I'm like huh? He said in Spanish I have stones. Ahhhhh phew! Relief it was. The ultrasound showed 3 stones and he said maybe head over to get an MRI to check the rest. At least my kidneys looked good, but that didn't stop the pain. The doc sends me out the door with a script for Ketorolac and Rowatinex. I had never heard of either before now. I picked up the pastillas and headed home. Not even 24 hours later I felt relief. Maybe a fluke right? Took the Ketorolac for only 5 days(apparently it's no bueno after that) and the Rowatinex for 2 weeks. I can't tell if one passed or not, but I felt Great!!! Fast forward to a few months later and I started to get that redness and burning again. Went to the Farmacia and knew to grab the Rowatinex and no script was needed. One day later I felt relief again and have been taking 3-4 a day ever since. I'll also add that erections are better and ejaculate has a lot more volume now. Interesting side effect… Take one before every meal and live again without worrying about stones :)

column7: I come from a long line of stoners.. kidney stoners that is. It seems to run in our family. Apparently, my family has a problem with calcium oxalate, calcium phosphate or a combo of the two. I have spent many miserable days and nights at the local ER because of them. Now, with so much pain med abuse, the ER's are reluctant to prescribe or give you anything heavy duty that works on the pain. When you have recurring stones, you start getting a little desperate. I keep an old bottle of Percocet in my night stand, as I am paranoid about having to suffer through another excruciating bout with these things. My last attack a few years ago was unbearable and the ER doc wanted to fob me off with Ultram! I had one kidney stone that was stuck in the bend of my ureter and according to the CT scan, I also had a total of four more stones in my kidneys (two in each). I started researching to see if there was anything out there that could possibly help, besides just diet modification. I found out about Rowatinex and started taking it. Knock on wood, I haven't had any more attacks. I have no idea if the stones passed or not, as nothing ever showed in the strainer. column6: It works and the proposed chemistry makes sense.
column7: I have had severe troubles with kidney stones over the years, and the Rowatinex capsules have helped me greatly. From what I have seen myself, Rowatinex helps reduce the pain of passing stones and helps the body make softer "matrix-type" stones that are easier to pass. I am a chemist, and I have read the literature about this medication. The proposed chemistry for how these pills work makes chemical sense. If you form calcium oxalate-type stones, this medication should make the calcium more soluble in your urine, and greater solubility means less calcium oxalate stone formation and likely softer "matrix-type" stones, if stones do form.

column7: My husband went to the doctor after what seemed like a kidney stone attack. The doctor said he had a kidney infection and some blood in his urine. He took antibiotics for 10 days, but still we saw blood in his urine. On the tenth day he had another more minor attack of pain. During this time, since I've always believed in natural cures, I started looking on Amazon for products to get rid of stones. I found 'stone blasters' with good reviews, but reviewers often said the pain of passing the stones would still be there regardless. Then I saw the Rowatinex reviews and noticed instead reviewers saying stones passed without pain, that they either became very soft or broke apart. I looked into the product some more online and only found good reviews, no bad ones, with no side effects, so this is the one I ordered. Since people used it for eliminating stones but also for prevention of stones, I'll be taking them as well, and also keep some on hand. After a day of taking the Rowatinex my husband was no longer passing blood, he's just finishing his first bottle (2 bottles in the box). I read online he should take them for a month, he's been on 2 three times a day. He hasn't had any more pain, blood, or problems since starting them. Amazon products always come quickly, within a few days, so while waiting I had him start drinking pure apple juice which is supposed to soften stones, which he continues to drink. I gave him a cup of cranberry tea each evening as well (he doesn't like cranberry juice) as cranberry is good for the urinary tract. I've known people who've had kidney stones and the bad pain they experience especially when passing them. From all the reviews I've read now on Rowatinex I'm very confident he won't have another attack. I'm going to also purchase their other product for gallstones. I know blood in the urine is not a good sign and can be scary but I read sometimes it's simply just the stones scraping the duct it's passing through. If the blood returns I'll definitely make sure he goes back to the doctor but I'm thinking this product has taken care of the problem. I wish I could say he actually saw a stone that passed but this is our first experience with kidney stones, we're not sure if he'd notice one 'come out', esp. if this product allows them to pass without pain. All I know is he's had no more pain, no more blood in the urine.

column7: I have been having kidney stones since 1993. The first time I went to the doctor ('93) I found out I had stones in both kidneys, a total of 15 stones altogether. I did the ESWL procedure and had a double "J" stint inserted (never again) the first round. A few years later I developed more stones went through the ESWL procedure once again. I had to take a few days off work after that one. Since 1993, I have passed dozens of stones (I have lost track it has been so many), mine are calcium based. I was on an on/off monthly cycle (one month on, one month off) of magnesium which seemed to help for a number of years; this was before I had heard of Rowatinex. At the beginning of 2012 the stones had returned once again, I used a heating pad along with Midol (yes, Midol) and Aleve for the pain. I ran across Rowatinex and read the reviews and thought I would give it a shot. Like the reviews within 24 hours I passed a decent sized stone (not sure of the size but a little smaller than a pea). Within the next two weeks I passed smaller stones but they were mostly sand-like and they all passed with the greatest of ease. My wife ordered the Rowatinex on a Wednesday afternoon and I had them by that Saturday. The pills are round and easy to swallow; you receive two jars each with 50 capsules. During the first day I did notice a camphor smell when burping but only happened once. Yes, the instructions are written in German but there is a small section in English, basically I take 2 capsules three times a day. I love this stuff! It is much cheaper and less painful than paying for the ESWL surgery. Worked well for me.

column7: I have been suffering from kidney stones on and off for over 20 years, in fact, I make so many of them that if they were diamonds I would be wealthy. Whenever I am about to pass a stone, It usually starts with blood in the urine and pain in the back from the kidney area and then I can actually feel the stone gradually, slowly and painfully move all through the urinary tract over the course of 2 to 5 days. So in August 2011, I got the initial symptoms of a stone again, and after having passed a huge 7mm stone the previous year (that got stuck, "OUCH") I went looking for options, and saw very good reviews about Rowatinex mainly from European and South American sites but not much info from the US; So I ordered it next day delivery and tried it at the dosage listed on the box. The first thing I noticed was the "camphor" smelling burps, then an increase in thirst and urination, and that is it for side effects as far as I can tell. After a day of taking the pills, I felt the stone move from the kidney, to the ureter (the tube between the kidney and the bladder) and it got stuck, (so it must have been a big one), a few painful jumping jacks later to help dislodge it, and off to the bladder it went, then I would have expected it's final agonizing travel to the urethra over a few days, but oh surprise, that never happened, after a couple more days of taking the pills it passed as sand which I could barely tell was there, I was very impressed! After it went out, I stopped taking the capsules, so I still had most of them left. Fast forward to December, and here comes a new one, as soon as the symptoms started, I immediately went for the Rowatinex!. Not even 12 hours after the first capsule, and out it went, PAINLESSLY! one thing I noticed is that it made the stone brittle, as opposed to diamond hard as I used to pass before taking Rowatinex. After years of buying stuff on Amazon this is the first review I post, I'm just that impressed and don't even mind that it is selling now for $10 less than when I bought it. I'm just glad Amazon offers it. It really seems that the insurance companies in the US rather have you get ultrasound therapy or surgery as opposed to getting a simple, cheap (it sells for $12 in South America and Europe, and $8 in Cuba) all natural capsule that takes care of the problem. But that's besides the point, my main point is that these capsules actually work.

column7: Some other reviewer claimed that this is homeopathic medicine. It's not. It's not one of those super-diluted pills that relies on your placebo effect to help you (or however homeopathic meds work). The ingredients of Rowatinex are: Pinine, Campheme, Cineol, Fenchone, Borneol, Anethol, Olive Oil. My dad's sister, who lives in Europe, was telling him about this product when he was complaining about getting a kidney stone for the first time in over 10 years. [He injured his knee and had to completely stop jogging for a year, and we're guessing this might have had something to do with why he started getting kidney stones again.] She said her doctor's given it to her before and even her dog has gotten it from the vet. My dad tried this product and used the directions on the box. We had been to the emergency room something like the night before, and scans showed he had three kidney stones, the worst one being something like 5 or 6mm in diameter. A few days after starting Rowatinex, my dad finally passed his kidney stone. Instead of being the normal, crumbly rock, it came out as kind of gooey and in the shape of an elongated tube. He said it was 9mm in length, though the diameter was much smaller. And he could barely feel it pass. Though, for the record, he was on good pain pills, but the pain pills didn't seem to help much in the beginning, before Rowatinex. Since then, he's been taking Rowatinex at a greatly reduced rate than what is on the box. It's been something like one to two years, and still no returned kidney stones (though he's also modified his diet a bit to exclude things like nuts, and he's able to jog a little bit again). I'm on here to purchase more since he's running out.

TL;DR It works and I am kicking myself for not continuing my maintenance of a pill a day for a year.I have had kidney stones practically my entire adult life, producing one every 4 to 6 months. 3 years ago my pattern changed tho. The nephrologist said "your kidney is functioning in normal levels" so they didn't suggest doing anything about it and I'm seriously dumbfounded, because of the amount of pain I was in. Pain makes us think differently, My next step was to figure out a way to make a DIY lithotripsy machine. Luckily I found the stonebreaker chanca piedra. Within a month I was back to feeling normal and I decided to take a bottle's worth of 1 pill a day as maintenance. It works at least for the uric acid based stones which is what I produced.

After learning about Chanca Piedra, I had to give it a try.I never saw the results that some people saw within a few days or weeks, but I stuck with my daily regimen, which I had decided on: 4 capsules 30 mins after lunch and 4 more 30 mins after dinner (as well cutting out ALL soft drinks, with the occasional one every 6-7 days).  I began on January 24 and at the time of this writing during the first week of March, I have ZERO pains in my stomach near the area of my galbladder.  I do have some slight pain in my right shoulder that began 2-3 weeks prior to this review, but it is starting to subside (which I would guess/attribute to stones moving through duct and some accompanying inflammation) .  More importantly - I am head-over-heels that I feel no stomach pain!!!If you are dealing with galbladder issues, this can't hurt.  Try it for at least 1-3 months if you don't get instant relief. column7: mightve reacted with thiazide which many kidney stone patients take, webmd says it is a known interaction; could not return. Only  medicine I take. Very terrifying, please do not buy until FDA looks at this stuff. ugh,from google gemini: Yes, it absolutely makes sense that you experienced dizziness and heart racing after taking chanca piedra while also being on hydrochlorothiazide (thiazides). Here's why:Additive blood pressure effects: Both chanca piedra and hydrochlorothiazide can lower blood pressure. Taking them together can lead to a more significant drop than intended, potentially causing dizziness and lightheadedness.Electrolyte imbalance: Hydrochlorothiazide is a diuretic that can cause the body to lose electrolytes, particularly potassium. Chanca piedra might further contribute to this imbalance. Electrolyte imbalances can affect heart rhythm and lead to heart palpitations.It's important to stop taking chanca piedra immediately.  The dizziness and heart racing you experienced are signs that these substances might be interacting negatively in your body.

column7: I've been taking various chanca piedra concentrates for kidney stones for the past year or so. I ran out just as a stone was starting to give me pain. Because there's no information about how much chanca piedra is actually in here, I have doubts that it's much at all. The rosemary is overpowering taste and smell-wise, so I can't tell if the chanca piedra taste/smell is present at all. I've been taking this as directed for about a week now, and the past two days have been AWFUL pain-wise, leading me to believe this isn't doing nearly as much as other extracts I've tried. Overall, I can't say whether or not this is what it says it is, but I have serious doubts.

column7: I've had problems with kidneystones for years, this last year was the worst. My last lithotripsy was a few months ago in September for a 1.3 centimeter stone. My last xray was clear, but the CT scan showed alot of fragments still in that kidney. I decided to try chanca piedra and started taking it. It was a different brand in pill form. I took it daily from that time for 3 months and it didn't help move out any additional stones. I didnt want more buildup back to a large stone again, so I decided to try this brand in liquid form instead. Ive been taking it once a week for about a month. On Thursday I felt a sharp pain in my right side just for a few minutes. I knew a stone was coming down the ureter. I came home and took a dose of this. This morning, I unknowingly passed 2 small stones. The stones were soft and disintegrated when I touched them with a Q-tip. They did not have the hard sharp edges that my prior ones did. I had no pain at all and didn't even know I had passed them! I can't believe it softened them that much! I know i have more, so I just ordered another bottle. I am going to take it daily instead of weekly. This liquid form works so much better than the pill form in other brands. I am going to continue taking this to try to move it all out and as a preventative after that. People need to have patience, sometimes this doesn't work overnight and sometimes it literally does. Some stones are more stubborn with higher or different mineral compositions and crystal concentration. One thing I promise it does, it 100% softens them and makes them much less painful as they pass from the kidneys to the bladder because the sharp edges are gone! I highly recommend giving this a try if you suffer from them like I have!

Took these pills daily for close to 9 months, and they did absolutely nothing. After CT Scan one month later revealed bi-lateral kidney stones, and the one in my right kidney has actually increased 2mm in size since my last scan 3 years ago. Do not waste your money on this garbage. I would recommend trying to follow a low oxalate diet and getting any stones you have procedurally removed if they are causing blockage or extreme discomfort.

Had a CT 2 months ago and had a 6mm kidney stone. Immediately started taking this supplement, and yesterday I had to go to the dr for kidney pain. New CT revealed the stone is now 11mm. Surgery is being scheduled.Don't waste your money.
What a waste of a $100. Gallbladder stones looked the same.

On the fourth day of taking it, I began to feel a terrible inflammation of the stomach and bladder. The doctor prescribed me medication for so much inflammation, but it did not help. The only thing that helped was stopping these capsules. I was hoping that they would help me with my kidney stones, but all they did was damage my health for a week. Do not buy it!!
I was in the hospital with kidney stones was sent home to pass then. I been taking the supplement to see if anything but nothing. Don't waste your money.
Didn't work won't buy again  is to expensive for not to work
I thought I had a kidney stone but I didn't

While sitting on the couch watch TV, March 2, 2024, I felt a terrible pain in my left lower back.  The pain intensified in just a few short minuets.  I was on my knees in pain about to vomit, face sweating, and could not find relieve in any position.  After 4 hours of this, I started looking through the medicine cabinet for anything that would relieve the pain so I could get some sleep.  As I could only find ibuprofen, I took two, which seemed to help, Saturday mooring I felt great!  I was even able to get a P90X work-out in, before going shopping with my wife.  Halfway through shopping, my symptoms returned.  I couldn't wait to get back home and take something for the pain.  I remember feeling every bump in the road as it shot pain up my back.  Again, several ibuprofens and 45 minutes later the pain was gone!  I went to my family doctor on Monday, based on a urine sample, she said it looks like a kidney stone.  As this was my first, I had no idea what I was dealing with.  An X-Ray and Cat-scan that day confirmed a 7,5mm stone was stuck in my ureter.  As this was said to be too large to pass, she advised me to contact the Urology Group in Cincinnati, and she put me on Flowmax.  Researching this on the internet, I started drinking lots of water with lemon juice and apple cider vinger each day.  Although still no pain, on March 13, the Urology Group performed an Extracorporeal shockwave  Lithotripsy to break up the stone.  Although they said the procedure was successful, breaking the stone into two pieces, a day later only some gravel and a bee-bee size piece were expelled.  Although still no pain, two weeks later a follow-up X-ray revealed the stone was still 6,5mm and still stuck in my ureter.  Therefore, aside from pain of the procedure and a cost of $10,000, the Lithotripsy did very little, and the Urology Group then prescribed a more invasive procedure of using a laser to go inside and break it up.  Not looking forward to another procedure and encouraged by the many successful reviews, I ordered this product.  In addition to the Flowmax and drinking 2.5 liters of water per day with concentrated lemon juice, I have been taking it as prescribed for two weeks now, with no results whatsoever!  I was discouraged to hear that this company recently changed their ingredients and the reviews since then have been far less successful.  Unless the pain returns, I believe I will try to wait this out to see if it will eventually pass.  I will repost as this progresses, and hopefully share with all a success story, but for now, this product doesn't seem to help at all!  For the past week, I doubled down on the dosage, two in the morning two in the evening, still no results!

I had high hopes when I purchased the kidney stone breaker after reading promising reviews. However, after a month of consistent use, I'm left feeling utterly disappointed and frustrated. This product did absolutely nothing to alleviate my discomfort or aid in passing my kidney stones.Despite following the recommended dosage diligently, I saw no improvement whatsoever. It's as if I might as well have been consuming plain water for all the good it did. Not only did it fail to break down my kidney stones as advertised, but it also failed to provide any relief from the excruciating pain I was experiencing.Save yourself the time and money – steer clear of this ineffective kidney stone breaker. It's nothing but a sham, offering false hope to those desperately seeking relief from the agony of kidney stones. I regret wasting my hard-earned money on such a useless product. Trust me, there are far better alternatives out there.
I have been taking these for my kidney stones for 3 months still nothing .doesn't work

I have taken Chanca Piedra Stone Breaker – Natural Dissolver, Kidney Cleanse & Gallbladder Supplement in addition to Peruvian Naturals Chanca Piedra “Stone Breaker” – 150 Tablets - Kidney Supplement - 2400mg and Herb Pharm Stone Breaker (Chanca Piedra) Compound for Urinary System Support - 4 Ounce for a total of 8 months.  I did an ultrasound two weeks ago and the kidney stones have not moved.  For me it was a waste of money plus the awful taste especially the liquid.
My wife has been taking these for about almost 2 months and they do not work they done nothing to help with braking up the stone
I tried these when I had 2 kidney stones , n i took them as directed and it didn't help one bit. I never felt any relief from the pain , or even helped move the stones or reduce them.

Purchased two and took one a day for 4 months. Didn’t help pass the current stone in my ureter at all and CT scan shows the two kidney stones that still in my kidneys are the same size. Seems to have no effect at all even after spending $40 and taking them for 4 months daily.

After several bottles of "Stone Breaker" I am so disappointed.  My 1 centimeter stone did not break, did not dissolve, did not disappear.  So many pills over a few months...save your money.  Had another CT Scan and after all this time...nada! still 1one cemtimeter.  I was also drinking the tea but...nada.  Some people who are prone to stones might have this help them, but I am now scheduled for surgery in January...a year after having these stones.  Some on the right side, some on the left side and after another CT, still there, still in pain every day.  Doctor says "some" people might be prone to them and if they are smaller, will break over time.  Not mine!  So, think this through.  Think before you pay out for these.  A year is too long to suffer.

After you get the product you read that this will take eight (8) weeks to begin to work. From the moment I have pain until it passes or I have to go to the hospital is between 1-2 weeks. At the onset of familiar kidney pain I need an immediate cure, not something that starts to begin to work over a month after the stone passes or after the hospital visit. Typical non FDA regulated snake oil.Amazon won’t even give me a refund. BEWARE!

Very unfortunately this did not work for me. I had high hopes, but no one is sadder than me that this did not help one bit after using it for 45 days. The doctor says my stones are very small and very passable, but here I am 5 months later.

In September of 2018 I was diagnosed with a kidney stone on the left side. I found Stone Breaker on Amazon and after reading the reviews I purchased a bottle. Later I went to the auto delivery method and I have taken it until a month ago. After the initial kidney stone attack in 2018 I had one minor attack a couple of weeks later, but since I had just started the Stone Breaker capsules I decided to wait and see. I have had NO other attacks or even "ripples" of anything since. A month age I needed a "cat scan" for another issue and guess what? The kidney stone was alive and well and living in the bladder wall. It was NOT reduced in size at all. It had not been passed or broken down. I had surgery today, Aug. 16, 2023 toremove it. I do not have any idea of how this product works for others, I am only reporting on my own experience with it. I did wholeheartedly believe in it.

Just a few sentences of medical history:I was diagnosed with gallstones in 2019. Since then, my attacks have gotten worse and worse. They used to last 15 to 30 minutes, and now they prolong for hours. So bad - I can expect to be out of commission for at least two days. But the thing of it is I don't want surgery and was trying to find any natural way to help dissolve my gallstones. By researching, I happen to come across Stonebreaker by Chanca Piedra. I read all the positive comments on this thread and decided why not. I gave it a go.I've taken these pills for the last 3 days. Morning and night with water and with my meal. No symptoms. I was thankful for that cause I was scared lol. On the fourth day, I had a late lunch - my first meal of the day. I ate lunch and took my pill. (I had a salad). About two hours later, I’m not even sure what the heck went wrong but my back and right side were KILLING me. I almost mistook it for a gallbladder attack, but eventually noticed the pain was something else - Not my usual gallbladder area under my breast, but my right kidney area (wrapping around my back and side). The pain was so heavy, it stopped me in my tracks and my husband helped me to the bed.My husband helped me by applying a heating pad to my kidney area. Within an hour the intense pain subsided. But the dull ache was still there. That was Saturday. I'm typing this Tuesday night and I can't bend over, twist and turn certain ways without that same dull intense pull/ache. And this happened on the 4th day of taking these pills. Sitting for long periods of time HURTS. Anything that applies pressure to my right kidney side HURTS. The only way I don't feel uncomfortable is if I stand.  I have never ever had a problem with my kidneys. Never. But now it seems I do. I'm praying the pain will just go away, but I will be visiting a Doctor Thursday if it doesn't.I honestly thought I was going to feel something in my gallbladder since there are stones there and not in my kidney, but that was NOT the case. At least for me, it wasn't. I discontinued use of these pills and will be doing more heavy research on them. I encourage you to do the same. I see that this is a good product for some people, and I'm glad they were able to help the majority. I’m not sure what went wrong with me. Maybe not enough water? Not enough rest? I am a very healthy girl except for my stones. I exercise and love eating healthy (especially since 2019). So, I don't know. I just felt like I should share my story because I know what it's like to have gallstones and have no hope of curing them with doctors always ready to cut on you. You are desperate for a solution and ready to try anything – I know I was. I will try to update my condition soon. But in the meantime, if you consider this product, just make sure you do HEAVY research on it. I found out some things if I had known sooner, I might not have purchased.
Does not work for me & I get stones a few times a year.

So I started taking these for about a week. Then I stopped because I didn’t notice a change. Weeks go by and then suddenly I’m going to emergency room bc of my left kidney have 2 stones in there 7mm and 6mm (confirmed at ER with ct scan. And the 6mm one was blocking my kidney and it became infected and twice the size of my right kidney. And the infection turned to sepsis. So I had emergency procedure done for stint. I went for pre-op appt today and showed my urologist the bottle and literally laughed at it while reading the ingredients. He said it will not do anything for stones. Calcium stones you can not take anything for bc your bones are also made of calcium. And uric acid stones there are medications for to reduce uric acid. I go next week to get the stones laser blasted and removed, then I have to go back following week for scan to see if there are more.Please just go see a urologist. And stop wasting your money on this gimmicks.The cranberry pills he did say are useful though for urinary health.
Took the whole bottle 2x a day did nothing! Did not pass stones and pain did not subside.

Took the whole bottle for one month. I wished I could have had severe abdominal pain on one side during taking this supplement (that's the symptom of how your body pushes the stones out of urinary tract) but nothing happened. No abdominal pain, no stone was out. Wasted $40. I'm very dissapointed!
Used the whole bottle and it DiD NOT break up the stone!!

After long research and reading thousands of reviews for this product, I decided to try it. The pills are easy to swallow but leave a bad taste in my mouth. After taking these pills for over a week, I started feeling a lot of pain, and my gallbladder was so swollen that it was protruding from my abdomen. I ended up at the ER. It felt like a gallbladder attack, and according to the physician, it was the pill causing acute inflammation. My gallbladder almost burst. After a week without taking the stone breaker pill, my pain is gone, and the inflammation is down. However, due to the damage the pill caused, I have to get my gallbladder removed.
This product did not help at all for kidney stones. Desperate times call for trying anything and these are not the solution sadly.
Just got new ultrasound and after taking these pills for over a yr my kidney stone got bigger and I have more of them on the other side. Total BS product DON’T BUY IT!

It is not stated that this should not be used in conjunction with your BP medications. This medication can cause your BP to drop dangerously low. Seriously, I rather pass 10 stones than deal with the side effects from this supplement. Stay away! Find something else, or drink lots of water. All the negative reviews are completely true. Take this as your warning.

They also didn't help with the pain at all. I had to take prescription pain meds for 2 weeks to be able to deal with the pain. The pills were a waste of money in my case.

I was diagnosed with gallstones may of 2019, I weighed 288. Through a vigorous low fat diet I lost over 100lbs and didn't have any flare up since May of 2019. After a week's use of this product I ended up in the ER with and inflamed gallbladder and pancreatitis. Ultimately was forced to go through surgery to get my gallbladder removed. Gallstones ARE NOT PASSABLE. They shouldn't be treated like kidney stones because THEY ARE NOT THE SAME. Attempting to pass a gallstone leads to serious complications. If you are experiencing pain DONT WAIT take it from me. Did not ease any pain, caused immense abdominal pain.

This product didn't work for a UVJ stone confirmed by CT at 6mm.  After reading all reviews, I was hoping this work work for me, but pain is still there that comes and goes randomly and when in pain taking it provides no relief.  After consulting with multiple health care providers, I deduced, for a stone in that's in urinary tract (Ureter, Bladder, Urethra) this products effectiveness is likely significantly reduced because anything consumed first enters the blood stream before filtered into the urine.  The chemical compounds in these pills, if they are needed by another organ, then it won't make it into the urine to help break up the stones.  I had takes two pills, three times per day, until finished the whole bottle, which is higher than normal dosage and that also had no effect.After reading all the reviews, I had hoped this would help me, but it didn't.

Do not take if you have a larger kidney stone. I have a 1.5 cm kidney stone. I took this hoping it would shrink it down but unfortunately it did not. I can see how it tries to move the stone through but since my stone was so large it cost me such extreme pain that I had to go to the ER until I can get it lasered out. I suggest to buy this for only smaller stones and not anything very large.

I am writing this review totally unbiased.  To start, I got word of this product from a youtube video, someone said that it worked very well also the reviews were outstanding.  However,my experience was very different. About 2 months ago I had my first gallbladder attack ,extremely painful and scary. I eat a very healthy whole foods diet prior, so taking this I figured would only aid in getting rid of any further attack or previous stones from not eating the best when I was younger. I bought my first bottle. Followed the instructions and for about 2 weeks, there was no pain, no sign of gallbladder attacks, I was convinced that this was the reason. I was so excited that I bought another bottle to have on hand before my first ran out. After 2 weeks of taking it,I was doubled over in severe pain. Worst pain of my life and nothing would take it away. After 2 days of chronic pain I was rushed to the ER where they told me I had a lodged stone, and pancreatitis due to the lodged stone. Worst pain you will ever feel! Also i was told that i would need my gallbladder removed immediately.  When removing my gallbladder a duct was clogged with what was described as sludge and mini stones. Now this could be a coincidence or this product was breaking up stuff and got it stuck in my duct causing all these issues. It is no joke when I say, take these with a risk. If stones are breaking rapidly they can cause a clog. I am all about natural products, but I fear this could do more harm than good. 2 bottles, waste of money. Would not recommend.  I need to get a refund. Good luck all.
I took the whole bottle in more than 1 week but I still got pain. Haven't pass stones. Not working for me.
Didn’t break or dissolve my stones still ended up going to the hospital and getting my gallbladder removed .

What the AD for this product fails to tell the consumer is Stone Breaker will not work on Calcium based Kidney Stones which account for about 90 per cent of all Kidney Stones! The AD is misleading as to what it can do. I do not recommend this product.

I took my first pill last night and I really wish I hadn't - I had a terrible reaction.  Be sure to look up the potential side effects of the two main ingredients.  I was dizzy (a possible side effect of hydrangea) and was stumbling around trying to get ready for bed.  I was also light-headed and nauseous (light-headed could have been low blood sugar, a possible side effect of chanca piedra, nausea is a possible side effect of hydrangea.).  I should note that I took the pill with a meal as directed.  I am typically healthy, except for gall stones, and I've been doing a keto diet for 14 weeks and exercising 5 days a week.  My guess is that this product caused a blood sugar drop a couple of hours after taking it and that I had a reaction to the hydrangea.  I know better than to take herbal remedies without better research than seeing a bunch of positive reviews.  I do believe that this does work for some, just not for me.

This is a rip off for me. I have 13 kidney stones, ordered this in hope to pass some vs surgery. Latest test showed no movement of stones. Took 4 a day for 3 weeks.. nothing!! Does anyone know how to get your money back from their 100% guantee.??

You're better off buying better food choices (non fatty, not fried, not saucy or heavily condimented, no chocolate & less to 0 red meat)...yes boring... but less pain and i lost 20 lbs which helps during gallbladder removal because loosing weight minimizes size of a fatty liver therefore smaller incisions.
