As of this writing, tonight my eyes have swollen significantly. I hope to avoid the ER tonight. $$$$ . . . If "EU NATURAL" cared about us, the fine print would be easier to read for our MEDICAL BENEFIT. Instead they cleverly mention their facility in discrete very small print. Many AMAZON CUSTOMERS have suffered because of this product.  . . . AMAZON should REMOVE "EU NATURAL Stone Breaker" before some type of litigation ensues. . . . . Screen Shot: 12-01-2024, 9:31 PM EST
My Doctor's said there's no known cure for Gall Stones, it has to be removed when it gets large stones in there.
This product had great reviews but unfortunately it didn't help me pass any stones. It did alleviate some pain so I gave it 2 stars but didn't really do much else that I noticed.

I took a break from my old standby, Kidney Cop, to try this product. After using it for a month, I could feel my stone nemesis forming up for another round of back pain and kidney suffering. So back to Kidney Cop it is!

I have two kidney stones and I started taking this a month and a half ago. Drank a lot of water did everything I need to do to get rid of the stones. Unfortunately, the 9 mm grew to 10 mm and I still have the 5 mm and the other kidney. I was hoping so much that it Would work. And may or may not prevent more stones from forming though,  that I don’t know.

So I had a kidney stone that was around 8 I bought this but also took apple cider ginger pills lots of lemon water stayed away from meat and chicken and tried drinking parsley water - that was nasty. However my kidney stone went down and was stuck in the same spot for 3 months . I felt pain and at the end had no choice but to remove it surgically . The doctor also gave me tamuslosin but he told me it’s a composed of calcium and oxalate and that’s hard for my body to break it down. Now that I removed it  I feel better yes it was a bit painful but 3-5 days of relaxing wasn’t so bad then vomiting every weekend and avoiding foods that make the pain worse !
I was expecting some side effects but no to the extent that it was more noticeable than my actual gallbladder stones.

I got my first kidney stone in March 2023 - it was 4mm. I found out I had my second in October 2023 and immediately bought these after seeing the positive reviews. I’ve been taking 2 in the morning and 2 in the evening for two months now. In about mid-December, I had a CT done and my 2mm stone had grown to 4mm so it seems this product did not help break down my stone at all. It may have helped with flank pain, but I’m not sure if it was acting as a placebo.
Was told I have a 15 mm stone was hoping this would help break it and pass it without surgery no luck!

I had high hopes for this product- I took one capsule before bed last night with 32 oz of water. I have two kidney stones, one in each kidney. It’s been three weeks of pain and no help from doctors or ERs. Well, I woke up in the middle of the night with horrible stomach pain and then had the worst bowel movement I think I have ever had and everyone in my apartment building probably heard it, at 3:00 am. Well, if they were awake. Maybe I woke them. Who knows. I’m scared to take another capsule but I’m desperate to get these kidney stones out of me. I’ll give it another go. I’ll keep the capsules though- excellent bowel cleanser.
I didn't see any benefit to the stone breaker pills. Im glad they helped some but this is not for me. I wont order anymore of this product in the future.
I tried it for 2 months with no result.  I have 2 mm kidney stone and nothing happened! Save your money.
Didn't break the stones. Didn't help the pain. Save your money. Pill was easy to swallow.

Got a 5mm stone said the CT scan. I’ve been taking this twice a day for 30 days. Nothing so far and tired of pissing into a screen funnel. Either this doesn’t work or it takes much longer to pass. Urologist said can take 8-10weeks to pass a stone. Can happen sooner I’m sure. So I’m hoping that this is making that 5mm to a 3mm or less stone. I haven’t seen any debris in the screen urologist provided. So in all take if you want. Not guaranteed to fix your issue. Urologist never heard of this product. I told them I was taking it along with Flowmax. Hope you find relief people!!!!

I gave this a shot for a week to help with Gallbladder pain. The only thing it did is make the pain even worse! What did help was taking digestive enzymes. I don’t know how this works for stones but if you have gallbladder inflammation… it doesn’t work.

Gave me a lot of constipation, finished one bottle but no results at all. I took one tablet a day with lemon water and one other Stone Free supplement. None of them seems to work although they control the acidity in my urine and make it a bit more alkalineBy the way I have one stone hanging in my right ureter of 6mm. After finishing one whole bottle, nothing came out of my ureter although I am using lemon water thrice a day

I can't speak to how this product works for kidney stones, but it did nothing for my gallstones and I took it for many months twice daily, sometimes two pills in the morning with lots of water. I recently had my gallbladder surgically removed because the stones were not "broken" but my gallblader had become inflamed and was a danger to my other organs.This isn't a cheap product, so think twice if you think you can break any gallbladder stones using this product regularly for an extended period of time. I cancelled my subscription and will apply that money towards supplements that help with my situation. I didn't give it one star, because like I said, maybe it works wonders for kidneys. But they should be honest about it truly working for both because kidney stones and gallbladder stones are different balls of wax, so I should have been more dubious of their claims. I guess I was hoping to avoid surgery in the future, but here I am recovering from surgery. If your abdominal pain increases like mine did, get a doctor to do an ultrasound and/or CAT scan to see if your gallbladder has gotten worse like mine did. Because left untreated it can harm other organs and cause more serious issues, like pancreatitis etc.
column29: twice daily, sometimes 2 pills in morning

column7: Didn’t work for me. I have kidney and gallbladder stones. No relief nor did I pass anything. Worth a try but just didn’t work for me

I bought these after noticing that I was having back pain and lower abdominal cramps.  Since I had a kidney stone 11 years ago and also knew that I had 2 stones that were seen during an ultrasound a few years ago, I knew I had another kidney stone issue.  I had hoped that these would work and wanted to avoid the Emergency Room at all cost (there is no other way to get medical treatment for a stone...you must go to an ER, at least here in the midwest).I took them as prescribed, then was told by a family member that I might want to double the dose, so I did that.  I also did "shots" of lemon juice and olive oil, which really helped the pain.  But I ended up in the ER a few weeks later and am scheduled for surgery to remove 2 very large stones from the right kidney.  There is a smaller one on the left, but I will leave that one alone for now.  Anyway, my stones didn't change in size (I had an ultrasound before taking them, then another in the ER) and I don't think the Stone Breaker had much effect at all, darn it.
Don't work
Mentally a good product, physically I don’t know if it really works. It helped remind me to drink more fluids,  but I still had stones than I couldn’t pass. Really unfortunate.
Just tried it even though don’t have kidney stones
I am using currently, half bottle finished but no kidney stone come out but only pain relief.
Purchased this to try and break up kidney stones it took a good while and eventually had to go to the hospital, not sure it was relief enough.

I had to return this item as I saw no difference in my situation. Hopefully it helps others, but I didn’t see or feel any change with my back or abdominal pain or discomfort, nor did it break any of my stones up.

My husband has been using this as he has kidney stone issues. He has been taking it twice a day and so far it does not seem like it is working. I’m disappointed but then again I did not have high hopes unfortunately.
After taking two bottles, i didn’t pass the stone.

I know many have said they had success with this product — I had very high hopes sadly This just didn’t work for me. Packaging is professional & it came quickly but unfortunately it didn’t produce any results Or change. I Ordered because of kidney stones in both kidneys. The company was prompt w/original inquiry and shipping though.

I gave these a try to see if they would help my Gallstone issue.  A sonogram revealed no change.  Maybe they are better for kidney stones as they did make me urinate more often or maybe they help some and not others.  But they were no help at all for me.  I did take twice a day as per directions.  Hate to give a poor review as the company seems nice.
Been taking this since Jan 21st and I feel more pain then I have been having... also no sign of kidney stone passing.... wish there was something I could do in a lot of pain
Didn't seem to help my husbands stones.

I had a kidney stone stint removed earlier today and I showed the urologist the bottle of Stone Breaker I had recently purchased.  He carefully read the label and said if it is meant to treat BOTH gall bladder and kidney stones it is snake oil and will not do a thing to prevent/eliminate kidney stones.  He said the two are completely different.He gave me some literature on what causes kidney stones, how to treat existing ones and how to help prevent future ones from forming.  Good reading.  I'll probably finish the one bottle of Stone Breaker, since I already paid $30 for it, but I will not be buying it again.

I took these Stone Breakers simultaneously with another Stone Breaker and after a couple of months...I made another appointment for another scan of my gallbladder and I still have MULTIPLE GALLSTONES.  My advise: SAVE YOUR MONEY.
Disk towel for me after a full month and a half.Good luck

I finished this bottle by taking the pills like described on the back of bottle. The only thing it may have did was stop pain when urinating. However, I still have the kidney stone. I've had my stone for weeks now. Will try something else. What a big disappointment.
Not working 3rd bottle still have stone
This makes having kidney stones less painful, but doesn’t dissolve them. Like most herbal remedies, since they aren’t regulated, they can be misleading.
did not work for me. by the way... just how are all these people finding their stones in their crap?.... i give birth several times a day, no luck.
It did not work for me. After taking this for a few days I had to have an ureteroscopy to get my kidney stones removed

I had a 10 mm kidney stone and started taking this product on December 31, 2017.  Used three bottles total.  Also took one bottle of Planetary Herbals "Stone Free" and drank more fluids including lemonade, water, lemon-lime diet sodas, and apple cider vinegar, all thought to help with kidney stones.  Still had the stone by February 28, 2018 and had a lithotripsy procedure to remove it.  Just asked for the 100% money back guarantee, hope it is honored.I feel the product itself, and chanca piedra is over-hyped on the Web as if it were a miracle supplement that would eliminate kidney stones in two weeks or so!I will give it two stars because while the stone did not disappear as I hoped for, the main symptom I had, (occasional visible urinary blood) did go away.  Whether the product actually helped with this, I am not sure.
Ok I'm taking apple cider vinegar along with these pills. My discomfort has vanished. I peed out a stone after one pill??
Don’t buy if you already have stones and are hoping it will help. I had a 7mm stone and took two everyday for a month. It didn’t budge Maybe it works better to prevent stones.

I have been taking it for 3 weeks. Not sure if it is doing anything for my gall stones without an X-ray, but it sure does make me run to the bathroom like crazy, and drink a lot of water. Have to wear bladder protection if I go anywhere.

My husband purchased these because he believes he has kidney stones,  but refuses to go to the doctor. He's been taking them for 1 week and so far no relief. He's going to continue to take them, maybe they they take some more time to work. Fingers crossed they do. On the plus side no side effects.  Will try to update in a week and see where we're at.
I bought these when I was suffering from a 4 mm kidney stone. It arrived the day after I passed my stone, so I don’t know if this works or not. My urologist did say that it was a decent brand though.

I developed a kidney stone a couple of years ago and thought this might be a good homeopathic option.  I've been using them for about a month and can't say I see any difference yet, but am willing to give it a couple of more months before giving it a firm rating.
N/A

I use Chanca Piedra for stone maintenance, a daily regimen that keeps those buggers at bay. Based on several of the reviews here, I decided to give this product a try and found it basically ineffectual. There is another Chanca Piedra product here on AMZ that is 90 caps for less cost and is more effective. I won't be ordering this product again - even dosing upwards of 5 or 6 a day does little to deal with my stones.The best solution to date is actually Kidney COP; but I only resort to that when a flare up is very intense as it also causes a buildup of uric acid which brings on a fit of gout.For maintenance; while it's hard to get, the very best Chanca Piedra is found at brick & mortar herbalist stores, directly imported from Peru, fresh and full strength.
column24: Better than: other Chanca Piedra, Worse than: Kidney COP

column7: They were a little big for me to swallow, the capsule type make the taste not very pleasant.  I’m afraid I really haven’t taken them long enough to realize the Benefits yet.
Didn't work for me. I had a 8mm stone had to go get a Stent then get it blasted. Might work better on smaller stones.
Still waiting to see if this is gonna help me pass my kidney stone

This is only kind that relieves my pain when it gets chronic cuz of the salt from my medication of blood pressure prescription & my adderall I take as needed. Watch your med intake cuz of the salt build up causes many stones. These capsules truly help me, I only take on days I take an adderall pill as needed to keep stones from forming. Just wish this was more affordable, too expensive for only a 30day supply
Didn't help with kidney stones.
Hello,I almost finish this bottle, but I was painful for my gallbladder stone. Should I continue this product? Just a month.Thanks.
Did not help me with my gall stones.

** This review is based on my husband's experience with a kidney stone that nearly put him in the hospital. If you are dealing with one that makes you think you're being murdered from the inside out, this review may help you decide on whether or not to give this product a try. I will be updating this review as time passes. I will try to be as detailed as I can be, and try to keep it short, sweet, and to the point.**Quick Facts & Helpful Tips:- My husband is 32 (first stone was at 22)- Unsure of what "type" of kidney stones he deals with- Has had 1 emergency surgical removal of a stone in the past- Has a VERY high pain tolerance- We do not have insurance & all medication is over-the-counterPrior to taking "Stone Breaker":- Was taking generic-brand regular acetaminophen for pain (did not help at all)- The pain was intense enough to bring him to tears and cause vomiting- Was unable to sleep for more than an hour or so at a time- Was unable to eat for days- Experienced irritability and increased stress levels- Had symptoms of this kidney stone for 7 days before "Stone Breaker"- Drank a gallon of water and 1 cup of lemon juice every dayAfter starting "Stone Breaker":- Capsules have no flavor and do not leave an after-taste- Taking product with or without a meal made no difference for him- Started taking 2 generic-brand acetaminophen arthritis pain-killers as needed (works very well)- Drinks a gallon of water and 1 cup of lemon juice daily- 2 days after starting product, went down to 1 pain-killer as needed- Has to pee a whole lot more than before starting this product- Uses a heating pad for pain, and it helps a lot- Is able to eat and sleep more regularlyIt's only been 2 days since he started the product and 9 days since the symptoms began. He has not passed the stone yet. However, he is able to get through the day without puking or ending up on the ground in tears since he began taking the product. Keep in mind that the amount of help that this product has given him is unknown because he had started the process of water and lemon juice 5 days prior to the product. Those two things are what they recommend to help with passing a stone, but there is a clear difference since starting the product. Again, I will update in a week, or if he passes the stone before that time.
Have kidney stones and nothing has changed.

I had a kidney stone for a total of 23 days. On the first day I was put on flowmax and stayed on that for the first 13 days. However, after a week I also started taking a liquid Stone Breaker drop until day 12. The liquid form should have lasted several days at least, but I finished two bottles within 5 days. I ordered this Stone Breaker tablet as the taste of the liquid was not great. It arrived on day 14. I took 2 capsules twice daily for a total of 7.5 days, then forgot the bottle at work, so I didn’t take the evening dose. The 3mm Stone ended up passing the following morning. I also drank probably 150oz of water daily from the beginning and mixed in lemon juice here and there. Per the CT Scans the Stone was stuck in the very bottom of the ureter the entire time, so luckily it didn’t hurt often. Maybe this helped keep inflammation down? Maybe not? I’m really not so sure the Stone didn’t just pass itself.

Odorless, flavorless, its not meant for pain relief. Easy to swallow like any other pill. My mom has been taking them for a while and hasnt reported any side effect. Only way to know to know if it works by getting an ultrasound to see if the stone changed in size. I will revisit and update my review.
I was hoping to get some pain relief for my kidney stones but there was no real improvement and I've taken almost 2 bottles.

I’m not sure how I feel about these yet.  There is some quality control issues that need to be addressed for starters.  I have had this capsule not filled and several others damaged.I don’t know if I have passed stones or if it has helped at all but it’s only been a week.
I do't believe  that the feedbacks are honest, I did not feel any sand or stones coming out.

I suffer from kidney stones and was excited to find this product.I usually go through about an hour of DEAR GOD KILL ME NOW pain when I’m passing a stone. It’s intense!!!! But I know that in about an hour it completely goes away for me. When I took this stone breaker it did lessen my pain BUT my pain lasted twice as long!!! So I’m not sure if I rather go through a hellish dying pain for one hour or a slowly dying pain for two hours.... this happened to ME & does not mean it will happen to you...  I’m 50/50 on these and have not kept up with taking them because I’m scared of prolonged pain :(  any advice???

I used mine with apple cider vinegar and lots of water in the morning while fasting untill lunch. For maximum effect. I noticed the cleanse but as it relates to stones and other things it releaves I can't say that it helped. I would recommend more that one bottle to use.
I was very excited to try this after reading reviews to hopefuly help me pass a stone ive been having issues with. This product definatly helped me flush my system, but did not pass the stone.

Product comes as it looks. Seems to be all manufactured. It does seem to help Gallbladder attack pain. It also helped with a lot of he small, tiny stones. The large ones. Nothing. I have it months of treatment. Even went as high as 1000mg 3x daily. Just wouldn’t pass the largest. Ended up with infected gallbladder. I tried all I could to save my precious fluid sack. We need everything in our bodies. But, once my gallbladder is gone, my body will adjust.
My husband has constant kidney stones ,hes been taking these about a month now and hasnt seen any difference..
I feel better today. Will update if stone passes.

I needed a kidney stone cleanse and I came across stone breaker which had a lot of good reviews. I've only started using it about a week now and It's probably too soon to notice any difference, but I'm hopeful I can give this product 5 stars.

Product does work, but the serving size is two capsules and for it to work as soon as possible you have to take two in the morning and two at night. And then wait a few days because it doesn't really take effect super quick. This makes it run out rather fast. For the price I would suggest investing in some natural changa peirda, which is supposed to help dissolve kidney stones and stop new ones from forming.

This apparently is one of those products where you aren't 100 percent sure it made a difference or not. But I had a stone just sitting right before the bladder, which eventually dropped and passed on when I had about another week of pills left.
I've not been taking it for long, so I don't know yet if it's helping.  I'll update the review soon after the stone is dissolved or has passed.

I had great hopes for this product after reading the reviews. After an adbominal scan last December because of constant stomach pain, we found out I had numerous gallstones, average size 6.5 mm. I changed my diet (I thought I was eating healthy!), drank tons of apple cider vinegar, and the pain went away. I started taking fiber, milk thistle and probiotics to help my liver and gallblader speed things up. I thought I was doing great avoiding surgery, but the pain came back a few weeks ago. That's when I ordered this product with extra fast shipping to boot!It seemed to help with the pain at first, but as soon as I eat a piece of cheese, more than two bites of meat or have a glass of wine, the pain comes back. Forget about dessert. I took the maximum dose per day (4 capsules) for 10 days, now I take two, but it doesn't matter. Anything else than starchy foods and fruits and veggies cause pain.I have ordered ox bile and will try Stone Free, as I'm a bit desperate and really want to avoid surgery (heard of too many people having other problems after that).

I have just a few tabs. left. I can not say it has done anything. I took it the way it was stated on bottle. I have had kidney stones all my life . I used WIDE WORLD for a log time , they also did not get rid of the stones. But did help to move them around when one would get hung up in my back or side.

Expensive... While I never passed a stone while using this product, I also missed a few doses and had gaps in my schedule taking this. I did take it as directed for a week or so, and my CT scan said kidney stons on left side no visible, but I have done a lot of Chanca Piedra and other remedies prior to this.I gave it 3 stars because it seems expensive and somewhat leaning to the gimmick side over a healing and effective side.
it works ever so slowly, been taking it as per instructions, eased the pain a great deal, but still have not passed any stones
I don't know if it's working or not because I didn't see any stone fragments going out.
In all fairness to the product I don't believe that  I had either kidney stones or gall bladder stones.

Have been taking the Stone Breakers for nine (9) days now and nothing has changed.  However, I have doubled up on the recommended dosage and I am taking two (2) twice a day for the past two days and I have had minimal pain, but have not passed the stones though I am drinking a gallon of water, cranberry juice and freshly squeezed lemon juice, which all of which seems to offer some comfort.  Stay tuned.  I have a Urologist appointment in March, which was the earliest appointment I could get unless I go directly to the ER, which is what I am trying to prevent since I had surgery to remove kidney stones in 2011 and I do not want to have to do it again.
Just started one week ago. So far, noticing a fairly good decrease in flank pain. Have not passed a kidney stone yet.
Didn't notice a difference and I have Gall stones..
Stopped my pain from kidney stones over night!But I have to take twice a day.
tried it for m kidney stone but I don't know it worked. I had to remove my kidney stone.

I purchased this product from amazon.com for my wife. she is having kidney stones for the last 3 years. 2 major hospitalizations. We find good reviews of this product and also through a friend. We are going to try this and see if it is helpful. We hope to write a better review after a few months.

I ordered this for my husband, and just received this order today so I'm not sure if it will work for him or not. I also ordered other products for Kidney Stones treatment since he has multiple stones and have reoccurring episodes of terrible pain due to these stones. Keeping my fingers crossed.
Finished the bottle and still feeling the stones might try another bottle
This product didn't help me pass the kidney stone. So I asked for a refund and I was refunded the full price.

Ill give it a 3 cause i really dont know yet, i havent had any more pop up, but time will tell. Put it this way its better than doing nothing at least taking these i have hope and hope is all you can pray for with kidney stones.

I really don't know how well this product work for crushing stones. I've been taking this for about 3 weeks and I haven't seen any stones passed.  I can say that it helps to ease the pain if not stop it just for that reason alone I would recommend this product.
If I pass the stone I will review

I started taking Stone Breaker 17 days after my discomfort started, then I passed the stone 20 days later.  I guess it's impossible to know for sure if this product caused the stone to pass, or if it would have passed with or without it, but the stone passed while I was taking it, so I'll give it credit.  This was my second stone, so I'm looking into taking this or some other "kidney cleansing" supplement to prevent any future ones.

I don’t really know if this product works for passing kidney stones yet. I have 1 mm kidney stone that showed up on a CAT scan a couple months ago but that’s a small one so I probably wouldn’t even feel it if I passed it.  I have constipation issues and this has actually made me more regular which if you look, the ingredients are known for doing that. Also feel like my urinating has less burning. therefore, based on my current results, I will order this again and keep trying it. It did not make me feel sick at all like some people have said I’m not really sure what they’re talking about

I got a CT scan in August revealing a 5mm kidney stone. I received these supplements on October 14. I’ve been drinking about 2.5 liters of water per day and have been in a lot of pain. The supplements did not help with my pain and discomfort, but Azos did. 3 weeks after I began taking the stone breaker supplements, I passed a 5mm stone on November 5th.I’m not sure if these supplements helped me pass the stone faster. It for sure did not break the stone into smaller pieces.

You got rocks? Hopefully the ones in your drive way or those shiney ones you buy. If not, this herbal mix might just be for you! I got rocks, had rocks and gave rocks the old fashioned way. Now I got these bad boys to help PASS the time away. Not only helping me dissolve the stones but holy urination Batman! I've never had to pee this much ever! Stand back congestive heart failure! Theres a new sheriff in town! Now rocks be gone and pee begone! Get yours today!

It’s been 2 days since I’ve been taking this product.. I will say I have been going to the bathroom a lot! But my stools are very hard idk if that’s a side effect or if it’s working I will continue to take this twice a day until I finish or pass my stones 🤞🏼 I’ll try to keep anyone updated
had to drink lots of water, yet gave relief and removed stone,

I think this product was working as I saw small stones. At first, the product was fine. By the 3rd week, all of a sudden I started having sudden hot flashes a few times a day that would last 3-5 min. By the end before I quit taking them, the hot flashes were coming on many times during the day. I checked the ingredients to see what the cause might be. After researching, the main culprit is the Boron and another possible culprit was the bioperine (black pepper extract). I'm a female who is 49 yrs old. Had a hysterectomy 3 yrs ago. I had quit having normal hot flashes 2 years ago. So this was troublesome. Definitely something to consider when buying this product. Great product otherwise. I'm switching to the stone relief cleanse instead as those ingredients are different and don't lead to hot flashes.

only rating a four stars cause i haven’t seen full results yet but i can definitely feel it yet i haven’t finished a bottle either so just follow the instructions you will notice results the caution comes when you don’t follow instructions like me and take it 30 minutes before work on an empty stomach, it works to well in fact i felt the stone is passing, just slowly and painfully due to my mistake this stuff is powerful like it says so eat a meal with it and you should be good also always drink water lots of water

I just recently found out that I have kidney stone on top of gallstones. I have been taking this supplement for about three weeks so we will see if it’s going to work or not. So far I really don’t know if it’s working or not but I’ll keep taking it.

I have had gallbladder issues for a couple years or so, mostly when my diet choices are on the bad side. My triggers are mostly fried food (canola oil), food with lots of fatty cheese and energy drinks.I am skeptical of natural medicine and this should medication should come along with some dietary changes in my opinion. You should not rely on this to save you. Luckily I seem to be able to pass stones, but at times the discomfort is worrisome.In my opinion this should be for the once in a while time you do happen to eat something not so healthy, or when you're unsure about it triggering an attack.I can definitely say when I've taken it, I haven't felt any issues....but I also have to credit the effort to stay away from trigger foods.
Works well been using it for awhile keeps the stones away

I like that it is in easy tablet form although I wish it didn't require taking so many doses. Eventually it does kick in but it nearly takes the entire bottle, in some cases.Having suffered from kidney stones for the past 40 years, I am thankful for anything that can actually help relieve my discomfort and pain

Bout this for my mom after rushing her to the E. R. Only to find out she had kidney stones. I honestly don't know if this worked but I can tell u after a few weeks doctors said the couldn't find any stones during her exam. I definitely would recommend trying. It Can't hurt to try.
I have many stones.  I've seen a reduction if not all but gone passing stones since I started taking this.  However, it does make your Pee smell bad.  I can handle that if I get relief from stones.
I have kidney cysts. I use it, and it seems to really help calm cysts when they feel inflamed.

I bought these for my 71 year old father who has kidney stones quite often. In the past few months they have become very frequent(every 2 weeks or so). After buying this for him he told me that the stones are still just as frequent but they break/crumble very easily as opposed to before when they’d be hard. He hasn’t told me if it’s any less painful but I assume it has to be less painful when coming out! If this sounds like a result you would want then I would recommend giving this a try. He hasn’t tried any other brands so we have nothing to compare to at the moment.
Not really sure if it did anything on it's own bcs husband took it with a kidney cleanse.  Both worked very well together for oncoming kindey stones though.

I've only had two stones. relatively small. A 1 and a 3cm. The 3 gave me problems. After taking this for about 2-3 weeks, they passed. Haven't had anymore since. Don't know if I can say this helped, but I'll continue to take it just in case. Don't want to go through that again.
I got this for my fiancé on June 10. He passed the stone on July 22!  I recommend doubling the dosage.

I was having really bad uti symptoms but none of urinalysis indicated infection. It was getting worse and I was admitted to hospital put on antibiotics and when I started getting better the hospital sent me home. Within a week the uti symptoms re-appeared, so I ordered stone breaker it came overnight and I took one on day one . The next morning I saw my first stone .. I also noticed my urine was clear again and for the first time since the infection started I was THIRSTY and actually wanted to drink water .  Please be aware it says to take with  8oz water and food . Please drink more than enough. You will feel depleted if you don’t take correctly .
Help with pain relief
I'm still taking them to avoid another kidney stone was hospitalized with kidney stones recently

This stuff really works! I kid you not after taking this product 2 weeks before my surgery I had two stones in my kidney. It was very painful. One 1mm and the other 7mm. I was in the ER back in november 2021 and was told I have a 6mm kidney stone in my left kidney. 3 months later, I started experiencing a lot of discomfort, burning when urinating, and a constant pressure feeling like I need to urinate. Many tests later, the scan came back showing that my stone is still in my track and it will need to be removed with surgery. I found Stone Breaker and ordered it immediately. The package came a day late so I am trying to play catch up in taking the pills in hopes of passing the stone before my scheduled surgery 1/17/22. I have taken 6 pills total over the last 2 days and have not passed any stone yet but I will say this is the first time in weeks I haven't had to take any pain medication. These herbs have definitely taken away my pain and have helped tremendously in helping me urinate. For weeks I've been sitting in warm baths for hours but since taking the herbs I haven't taken a single bath and have slept through the night. I was told that one week before surgery I would need to stop taking any vitamins or herbal supplements before surgery which would mean I have to stop today. I am so determined to pass this without surgery I am going to take these for 1 more day in hopes I get lucky and can cancel surgery. I read a review here online of an x-ray technician stating if the stone is obstructing your tract then these will not help. Unfortunately mine is obstructing my tract so If i don't pass it before my surgery, I'll know why. Either way I plan to continue taking this medicine after surgery as a preventative. Rated 4 stars only because I haven't passed it yet but I believe if I had more time before surgery, I might have been able to pass the stone with these.

I opened the capsules and put into soft food. I should have stayed with this product before I opted for a cystoscopy and Laser lithotripsy for a kidney stone. It was done under general anesthesia and a stent was put in to allow the pieces of the stone to pass. I have been suffering greatly for 3 days so far. First a whole day of nauseas and dry heaving and painful constipation from the anesthesia, the latter lasting 2 1/2 days. Also  pain, fever, bleeding and burning when urinating, weakness, loss of appetite, hypersensitivity to smells, and various body pains in upper and lower back which interfered with sleep. It's been a nightmare. And I still have to go for stent removal in a month. It's all too much, too violent and traumatic on the body. Please try this first.

A couple years ago I had several stones removed but there were still a few small fragments left in some hard to reach places. I did a ct scan and just reviewed it with my Dr. I told her that I had been drinking apple cider vinegar 3 times a day, and taking some other stuff to try to dissolve the stone fragments. She said she didn't think that was possibly because the stones were made of calcium. But then when she looked at my scan and measured the fragments she said the largest had gone from 5 mm to 3.9 mm. (Mind you I just started taking the Stone Breaker about a month ago) She was pretty happy about it and told me to keep doing what I was doing. Then she said "You know I have this other patient who took some stuff that seemed to shrink his stones. It was called Stone.. Stone" and I said "Breaker" and she said YEAH that's it." So whether it's the Stone Breaker or the apple cider vinegar, or a combination of both, something seems to be working.

I had struggled with a pain in my side for several months.  Th family doctor said it was 'muscular-skeletal' but I talked him into giving me an MRI.  This showed the Kidney stones - two of them, slightly smaller than a pair of dice.He did not have any easy solutions for me - surgery would be very expensive.  So I went to a naturalist who recommended Magnesium tablets, which I took for about two weeks.  I did not sense any results, so I started hunting for something else on the web, and found these on Amazon.  Along with the Magnesium tablets, I started taking these tablets (or maybe they were capsules - I do not remember) twice a day.  This worked.  After about a week of taking these twice a day with about 8 oz of water, the stone passed, relatively painlessly.  The only problem was the the pills seemed to cause bouts with sudden, unexpected, and almost uncontrollable diarrhea. This started the third day, I think.This was still vastly preferable to other ways of dealing with the stones, and the pills may not have this effect on you.  I have no way of knowing.  But you might want to be cautious with your plans the first couple of days that you take these pills.

Early January 2018 start experiencing cramping pain in my abdominal area thought maybe it was just gas tried to push through ended up having to go to the emergency room a little morphine and I felt great doctor mention doing further test since I have no insurance I turned it down figured it would be a one-time thing.. then about 3 months later same thing rush to the emergency room and had the test done doctors found kidney stones which I have been getting for 30 or more years and also found gallstones. The doctor came back in the room and said he was going to prep me for surgery again I was pumped up with morphine no pain thought I would just go home and investigate further as far as homeopathic cures then I stumbled across this chanca Piedra which as I understand translates to stonebraker figured for $30 what did I have to lose. So I took two a day for about 4 weeks had no flare-ups stop taking them for a while had a flare up Fourth of July 2018 at a barbecue on my way home became nauseous threw up when I got to my driveway got in the house took two capsules lay down and literally within 15 minutes felt completely fine I have  had a few other flare-ups in the meantime and I always carry a few of these with me every single time I have had one I popped two of these and pain is gone don't know why the doctors don't recommend this before surgery but I feel like it's a miracle cure.Update: Okay so I had another gallstone attack yesterday (9-27-18) at 4 am I woke up with a slight pain and got up immediately and took two caps. NOTHING! Pain increased to the point after 4 hours I was taken to the emergency room again to get Morphine. I probably shouldn't have eaten the three greasy tacos late the night before. I am going to get back to taking one every day to see what happens and stay away from the grease as much as possible. I will update in a few months to see how it goes. I still believe they work to a point but time will tell.

I started taking this because I had bilateral kidney stones that were refusing to pass. I was also diagnosed with gallstones a couple years ago, so I thought it might help with that, too. I waited another week and then went to the ER (I don’t have a regular doctor and this is beyond urgent care). Turns out I had a 6mm gallstone blocking my bile duct. But I wasn’t in real pain, just moderately uncomfortable (although sustained discomfort takes a toll, too). I ended up having to have my gallbladder removed but I am pretty sure it was Stonebreaker that kept me from the excruciating pain I should have, by all rights, been in. I gave it 4 stars only because this is obviously anecdotal and it may not have been the reason for my lack of pain. But that in conjunction with my lack of pain passing the stones makes me give these the credit, for what my anecdote is worth. I’d recommend it for anyone with chronic stones of both types.

This is the first review I have ever made on any product. I hope my review will bring you hope if you are struggling with kidney stones.It started in the summer of 2022 when I was 4 months pregnant. At the time, it was UTI like symptoms. Due to my pregnancy, I was unable to take any type of herbal supplements I was just given pain medication. I dealt with the intolerable pain for two months and when I was 6 months pregnant I had emergency removal of 2 stones one on each side- 0.5mm and 0.8mm following stent placement for a week and stent removal and yes- that felt like I was giving birth. MRI performed before the removal of the stones showed I had 2 smaller stones on each kidney which were not removed during the procedure.Fast forward a year later- July 2023 I started with UTI like symptoms once again. I knew right away they were the kidney stones. I went to my urologist to test for a UTI and she confirmed there was indeed blood in urine confirming stones. I decided to try this product as it was my only and last hope as I was preparing myself for yet another removal procedure and financial strain on my savings. Ordered on Sunday night, product arrived on Tuesday and took as followed:1. Tuesday night- I had excruciating pain (pain level 9). It got worse when I took a glass with lime. Flank pain started and I took two supplements. Thirty minutes later I had very little to no urine and my bladder was hurting. I was debating whether to go to the ER. About 45 min into the pain I felt sharp pinching as the stone was moving down my urethra. Immediately after the sharp pinching feeling I was able to urinate.  Pain diminished slowly and was able to rest for the night.2. Wednesday morning- While fasting as soon as I woke up I took another glass with lime and added apple cider vinegar. I took one supplement with it. I was feeling ok throughout the morning with mild UTI like burning symptoms. By the afternoon after having some lunch, I had another glass with lime and apple cider vinegar. My pain increased to sharp pinching feeling in my urethra and pressure. I knew the stone was there and was a matter of time before I urinated it out. About an hour into my pain when laying down the sharp feeling intensified and all of a sudden it was gone- instant relief?! I ran to the restroom I heard a clank on the toilet bowl and there it was the stone!I will continue to take this to hopefully dissolve the others out. I highly recommend this product along with taking it with lime water and apple cider vinegar. I hope to never look back on kidney stone surgery removal and I hope you never have to go through that. God bless.

The urologist hasn’t told me, because he apparently is too busy.My bladder is totally reacting to this! I never heard so many noises in my bladder.I’m scared, but I don’t trust the Dr. and he has never even had a stone. He couldn’t care less. I trust the actual results of people who have taken this more than I trust him. I’m 35 and have passed at least 20 kidney stones. I’ve been in the emergency room four times, and a week ago my kidney decided to let loose the largest kidney stone I’ve ever had. The CT scan measured it at 5.2 mm, and my doctor said if I didn’t pass it in a week I needed to schedule lithotripsy. He didn’t think I could do it myself. I have been doing everything. I’ve been taking herbs, drinking water and coconut water, taking homeopathy, etc. I’ve taken Chanca Piedra in various forms for years, including capsules and tinctures. In a moment of desperation, I ordered this tea. It arrived yesterday afternoon, and I had one mug full of it. Immediately, I noticed a very relaxing feeling come over me and the pain decreased a little bit. I felt more myself last night than I have in the past week, and I finally felt hope that I would be ok. About 24 hours later, I painlessly peed this stone out. You can’t tell from the pictures, but it is smaller than the 5.2 mm the hospital said it was. It’s also smooth (I’ve passed several that had huge teeth). I doubt this tea is solely responsible for me passing the stone, but I know it played a huge part. I will be drinking this regularly for the rest of my life.

My mom had kidney and gallbladder stones, she feels much better and less pain since she started the treatment.  She feels like she is passing sediment through the urine. Overall she is getting better every day

I don't know why but it works. I was having a big gallbladder pains. I've been having gallbladder problems for 5 years and they never remove it in the ER. So i was having a flare. I can always tell when it's enlarged and full of stones and slugde. I bought this because I read good reviews. Thinking it wasn't gonna work and i was gonna end up in the ER again. so as soon as I receive it, it soon began. I can feel it getting angry and angrier. I was in so much pain. By this time I wasn't eating anything. So middle of the day came and i had another 2 tea bags, oh boy it got angrier. Then night came and i had 2 more tea bags (always drink it really hot and no sugar or anything else on it). By the night i was in agony. I was crying and in labour with stones. One after another after another. So the next morning i had 1 tea bag. It kept going. I can still feel it's large and angry. I kept drinking 1 tea bag 3 times a day despite being in agonizing pain. I was crying and just wanted to stop. But I pushed through. Finally the pain of stone passing stopped. But it wasn't over, i still have a large gallbladder filled with sludge. Now that had to come out. We are 3 days in and i kept drinking the tea (3 times a day). But the sludge was only coming out slowly. Finally 7 days later my gallbladder is empty and back to normal. Avoided a trip to the ER and surgery. Thanks.Edit: what I went through is not for everybody. It was a battle at home. I did everything while on a liquid diet no sugars or solids as well as nothing greasy. It has been years and still no pain and no stones and I eat healthy but back to normal. Thanks.

column7: I have a history of having kidney stones. Particularly, I’ve struggled with excruciating calcium oxalate stones. Although I try to follow a low sodium diet and avoid high oxalate foods, I still occasionally get them. This tea seriously works. I don’t know if it dissolves it or gets rid of the rough edges, but it incredibly is effective for me.  It has most certainly saved me from surgeries and trips to the ER. I keep it on hand in my medicine cabinet.

I had  a 4mm kidney stone trapped in my ureter. After two ct scans over a month time, it wasn’t moving.  My doctor advise against OTC supplements, but I was desperate.  I was scheduled for surgery and a friend bought me this tea. I used two bags a day for a week. I also drank lemon juice with water. I was only able to drink this for a week leading up to the surgery. Well, surprisingly the surgeon was not able to find the stone. It was gone. I don’t know if it was the tea, or a combination of factors. But surgery result was the best possible outcome. If I get another stone, I am trying this first.

column7: I was absolutely floored and terrified when the doctor told me I had a 10 mm kidney stone. A year ago it was 5 mm. column7: 3 or 4 years ago I discovered this product on line with it's many positive reviews.  I also found that I could buy it from the closest Natur-thyme grocery store in Dewitt, NY.  The first time I bought and used a small bottle of it was a month before I was scheduled for a KUB, sonogram and my next urologist appointment.  Mind you, I've had high blood pressure since 1980, and been under doctors' care with a urologist, plus a nephrologist ( 5 years).  I also had lithotripsy twice, which broke up the largest stones somewhat, but that's about all it did.  I've maintained a low oxalate diet, plus 64+ oz. of water with lemon juice, especially since retiring in in 2006.  Nothing was stopping the slow growth of kidney stones or the gradual rise of blood pressure.  Finally, after using this as directed for a month, the tests showed the stones were decreasing.  I never felt anything pass, although for the first time ever I had seen 'gravel' after urinating.  So I've continued taking it sporadically for 3 years.  Since January, Natur-Thyme has been back ordered on this product for several months.  I found it on-line, and am trying to stick to a 15 weeks regime.  I know it works, although I haven't told my urologist.

column4: Herb Pharm Chanca Piedra Liquid Extract 1Fl Oz
column7: After being knocked down for 8 hours in excruciating pain, CT Scan showed I had 6mm kidney stone in my ureter. The doctor handed me pain meds and said "good luck". So I purchased this product as part of a desperate attempt to save myself from additional pain.  My overall menu changes included the following plan:- eliminated sodium and oxalates including spinach and nuts which I ate a ton of- lowered calcium, alcohol, and coffee intake as much as humanly possible- stopped taking my normal daily vitamin- added Neeri tablets also purchased on Amazon (3 tablets x3 per day)- drank a ton of lemon juice, lemons in all my water, and eating a ton of watermelon- mixed in apple cider vinegar when I hit my lemon juice max- a kidney cleanse daily tablet (2 tablets x1 per day) used the Health Plus version- doctor prescribed Tamsulosin = Flomax (1 tablet x1 per day)- then this product Chanca Piedra stone breaker (1 stopper full x3 per day)As you can see a lot going on but after 30 days of no pain X-ray showed the stone was still there but re-estimated at 4mm.  Then on day 50 another follow up X-ray showed no stone. The same doctor that said "good luck" now all he could say was "congratulations". The stone had passed with no additional pain and celebration ensued. Hopefully someone else will benefit from my experience because I do not wish kidney stone pain on my worst enemy!

It continued until I was able to take another brand (Disolvatol), at which point the pain faded within a few hours.  It might work well for others, but I'm going back to the brand I originally used as soon as they're available again, or stick with the Disolvatol.

January 22, 2021: Did not dissolve gallstones but does help with biliary cholic pain in the middle of the night. Stone Free works a bit better for pain but it has licorice root in it and it gave me chest pain separate from the gallbladder pain sometimes. Licorice root can cause kidney or heart failure so watch for signs of pain, in anything you try really. I did not want to be on Lidan Paishi Pian or Jin qian cao for longer than a bottle, as those have arsenic and lead in them but they're also known to help dissolve stones. Those pills did nothing for mine there either, a lot of good painkillers though.I heard Rowachol and TUDCA work better for gallstones specifically. Google dosages and you'll find them. I'm 104kg and at 10mg/kg that would be 1,040 mg in a day for TUDCA. Split 3 ways  is 346mg per meal. 500mg was too much for me and I got pain. Start small on the 250mg bottle for TUDCA. Good luck to whoever is reading this.**UPDATE April 7, 2023: Definitely do Rowachol and TUDCA. I no longer have a stone stuck in the neck of my gallbladder! I ate a flexitarian diet and used Dandy Blend coffee powder to replace coffee for a while. Switched to almond milk. If you have serious inflammation after a gallbladder attack I highly suggest laying off the meat for at least a month or 2. Just my experience, I'm not a doctor.

I Have been taking Flomax along with a higher dose prescribed alieve (pain reliever) for the last 19 days, and also Chancapiedra for the las 18 days. Today I started to take a combination of ginger, turmeric and holy basil herbs to substitute the intake of alieve (I don’t want to destroy my stomach with high dosage analgesics) and it is helping with the pain. My husband has intermittent bouts of Gout, depending on his diet, the weather, and how much water he does or does not drink.  When he has experienced an episode of it, he hurts.  It stinks to see someone I love hurt.I bought this supplement on a whim to see if it helped, and it has.  He states that he definitely feels better when he is taking this.  He can take this routinely, or he can take a medicine prescribed by his health care physician.  He says that this supplement reduces episodes, and that he feels better when he takes it.As to the science, it holds up.  While not approved by the FDA, clinical studies have found that chanca piedra reduces urinary oxalate and uric acid -- this stuff reduces the ability of your pee to create kidney stones.  A 2014 study found that chanca piedra has the ability to inhibit the growth of H. pylori, which, as an organism, is a jerk:  it's connected to cancer and stomach ulcers.  It has been found to help people with hep B by stopping its growth.  The reason that chanca piedra helps fight gout is that gout episodes occur when high levels of uric acid present in the body.  Less uric acid, less gout.My husband took this for a month to see a difference.  Now he asks me to re-order it when he is running low.  I take this as a real sign of its efficacy, because, well, he's a man.  Ha ha.I recommend that anyone with gout symptoms give it a try after reading up on its contraindications and talking to his or her doctor.  We did, and it is now a constant in his medicine cabinet.

The citrate was in a nice form between crystalline (like sugar) and powder (like flour).  Easy to use and weigh out.  I dissolve it in distilled water.  I am using it to replace expensive pills to counteract kidney stones.  Our doctor has approved the replacement. The pills were large.  The doctor's nurse said that using dissolved citrate might be easier on the stomach.

I ordered it as a supplemental source of potassium. I did not want pills, as they always contain excipient ingredients. Unlike lite salt (which also contains potassium) this is a bulk product that contains no sodium. Great!Also, its citrate has two side side benefits:1) Citrate intake helps to prevent the most common type of kidney stone.2) Citrates inhibit an enzyme that supports one stage of glycolysis, making them useful in reduction of high blood sugar levels.My visual inspection of the powder I received showed no clumping. That testifies to the thorough sealing and air tightness of its packaging, because potassium citrate is very hygroscopic. I looked for obvious contamination, but saw no foreign matter in it. And it dissolved readily in filtered tap water.Potassium citrate formula : C6H5K3O7So there are 3 atoms of K per molecule of potassium citrate.Thus, potassium citrate is comprised of (3×39) / 306 = 38% potassium (K)With my AWS model AC-100 100 gram digital scale I measured a ¼ US cup volume of Bulk Supplements Potassium Citrate granules to be 63 grams. Since ¼ US cup = 12 US tsp, and the USA adult DV of K is 4700 mg, we have for this supplement :½ tsp = 2625 mg C6H5K3O7; 998 mg K; 21% DV1 tsp = 5250 mg C6H5K3O7; 1995 mg K; 42% DV2 tsp = 10,500 mg C6H5K3O7; 3990 mg K; 85% DV3 ¼ tsp = 17,053 mg C6H5K3O7; 6480 mg K; 138% DVSo the 275 mg serving ( which is only 0.05 tsp ) labeled on this powder's Supplement Facts is insignificantly small. That dose provides only 2% USA adult DV, which is incorrectly labeled as a 3% DV for K. The next richest supplementary source of K ( to this citrate powder ) is Morton Lite Salt, but 2 US tsp of it would be required daily in order to get 80% DV of K, and that would mean an intake of 96% of the sodium DV.TIPSIn general, American adults are recommended to get at least 4,700 mg (100% DV) of potassium daily, while limiting daily sodium to 1,500 mg.  But most Americans are not meeting either goal. See the two USDA reports: 'Potassium Intake of the U.S. Population' and 'Sodium Intake of the U.S. Population'. Perhaps the U.S. National Library of Medicine has set the potassium DV absurdly high? The Austrailian Ministry of Health has set their adult men's DV at 81% as high as the USA's, and their adult women's DV is only 60% as high as the USA's.The richest dietary source of potassium (K) is not a banana, but chard. However, it is extremely high in oxalate. A baked potato (with skin), is richer in K than a banana, but one would have to consume five of them per day in order to obtain 100% of the USA adult DV of K !Extended release potassium citrate tablets are prescribed as a long term therapy for treating calcium oxalate kidney stones. The daily intake of those tablets totals 6400 mg as four equally spaced doses. These patients are also advised to restrict their dietary oxalate intake, while increasing their intake of water.CAUTIONThere is a purity issue with this Chinese product. Bulk Supplements did not provide a certificate of analysis with the package. That should be a document prepared by an independent 3rd party. Had they provided an acceptable report I would've given this product a 5-star rating.

column7: Great substitute for Urocit-K which is outrageously priced.  This 1 Kg bag contains exactly the same product as the pills and is the equivalent of 1,000 10-mEq pills which would cost $1,500 at a discount drug store!!Pretty easy to figure out dosing with a letter scale a tsp measure. If you need to take Potassium Citrate daily (20-40 mEq per day) to reduce kidney stones this can save you $2,000 per year.  Thank you BulkSupplements.  We love the savings.

This is a great source for pure potassium citrate - exactly what I wanted because I'm not getting enough potassium and terrified of kidney stones. It comes in a thin white powder that dissolves very easily.I'm only bothered by two things - the zip seal of the packaging is a little difficult to seal, and sometimes I end up with white powder over the counter. Another is that it is metallic-tasting (totally awful, I don't know how other reviewers are saying it's fine) and has an aftertaste as well. I followed the advice of another reviewer and put lemon juice and stevia in, which actually masked the taste completely.Overall I'm very happy with this. It's way cheaper than buying potassium pills from the pharmacy or sprinkling (expensive) salt alternative on everything.

I take a total of 1/2 tsp (~3000 mg) per day dissolved in water to aid in the prevention of kidney stones. This works out to ~28 mEq/day at a total cost of $0.12/day. Price certainly beats prescription potassium citrate (Urocit-K), which is in on the order of $1.00-1.50 per 10 mEq pill. Have no way to test potency or purity, so hopefully the supplier can be trusted.In patients with severe hypocitraturia (low amount of citrates in the urine, a risk factor for the most common type of kidney stones), the starting dose of Urocit-K is 60 mEq /day (30 mEq two times/day or 20 mEq three times/day). For mild to moderate hypocitraturia the starting dose is 30 mEq/day (15 mEq two times/day or 10 mEq three times/day).

I have recently added this to magnesium citrate (same supplier) to help prevent kidney stones (which I have had). After a lot of research on this subject I found the most useful item to be an abstract on a gov. site from an article in the 12/97 issue of the Journal of Urology. In a 3yr. study the group given potassium-magnesium citrate showed that it reduced the risk of calcium oxalate stone formation by 85% compared to the placebo group.The potassium citrate powder from BulkSupplements comes well packaged in a resealable pouch. The powder has no taste and a pinch (about 250 mg) dissolves completely in a glass of water. I usually squeeze half a lime to it for extra citric acid.

Quick delivery and well packaged.  I decided to try it since my daily potassium intake rarely ever approaches the daily recommended allowance.  I enjoy sweet potatoes and bananas, but you have to eat a lot to make it anywhere close 2500 mg or more.  I also wanted to try to this product as prophylactic measure against kidney stones and gout.  I have three members in my immediate family who have had gout attacks and I was unfortunate enough to have one attack over a year ago after three straight weekends of barbecue, beer, and shellfish.  The attack only lasted a week and I haven't had one since, but I do not ever want to experience one again.  Now this is internet science, so take it for what it's worth, but I've read that potassium citrate helps dissolve both uric acid and calcium oxalate so that it is excreted through the urine as opposed to ending up in your bloodstream and settling in your joints and/or forming accretions in your bladder/ureter/kidneys.  I haven't conferred with any physicians to get their two cents on the issue, but I'm hoping that by adding a small amount of this product to my diet, I won't need to see any doctors to treat or diagnose either ailment in the first place.  Speaking of dosages, the package contains a very large amount of concentrated potassium citrate, so heed the other reviewers' warnings to avoid any adverse effects.

Usually have this in the liquid form but couldn't get it so I decided to try the powder and see how it works. I was told by my doctor to use this to help with my kidney stones. I have used it and my son who also has kidney stones used it and he recently passed one of his stones. He, like myself have one concern and it is that you feel some what dizzy (not sure if it is really dizzy or just a bit nauseating) after use. However, I still use it and take just a teaspoon with water or juice a day.

Our vet suggested potassium citrate for one of our dogs who tends to form calcium oxalate stones, due in part to acidic urine. While taking potassium citrate her urine pH is now slightly alkaline, as we had hoped. Moreover, this brand is not only affordable it is also high quality and palatable for our dog. Really glad that this product is available through Amazon.com.

I ordered this supplement for my wife to help prevent kidney stones. At first I accidently ordered Magnesium Citrate, and tried to contact Bulk  Supplements before it shipped to make the correction. I wasn't sure my e-mail got there in time but when I received the product the change had been made. Before trying the product, I read many of the reviews, purchased a scale, and calculated the weight that would correspond to the Rx her doctor had written. So far, it's been great. It dissolves easily and has very little taste, which has been good for my wife as she has a high sensitivity to tastes. We mix it with orange juice, and then she washes it all down with extra water. She has a test in two weeks to find out how it has affected her urine alkalinity, and if it has worked the way we want, it will mean a great savings over the cost of the prescription.
I give this to my Yorkie to help prevent kidney stones. He has an allergic reaction to most fillers so I love the fact that this is a pure supplement.

I bought this in order to prevent further kidney stones (ive had 5), and as far as i know, the only drug prescribed for the prevention of calcium oxalate stones is Uricet-K. Uricet-K is nothing more than good old potassium citrate. Its prescribed in "meq"s, and i did the conversion math and now take enough potassium citrate to equal a moderate dose of Uricet-K (it is appx 1 &1/2 tablespoons of potassium citrate; i forgot the meq's). I know this: after a week of taking it, my urine ph went from 4 to 7. Calcium oxalate stones only form in low ph urine, so this is bound to help. Hope it is sufficient to prevent another stone!

Perfect! Pure source and as described. This will go a long way to helping me get more Potassium in my diet and to also prevent kidney stones. I trust BulkSupplements as they provide the best supplements for a diet that money can buy at a great value and offer a good alternative to vitamin shops.

Not having enough magnesium could also cause the problems since it affects the blood potassium level, along with certain metal toxicity (barium, thallium, cesium, etc) interferes with potassium absorption.Potassium citrate is a urinary alkalinizer with an added benefit of preventing kidney stones. Potassium is best taken in food forms (bananas, avocados, greens, beans, etc), but if you tend to overindulge in diuretics such as wine/beer/coffee, be sure to supplement with key minerals, such as magnesium, potassium, iodine, selenium, zinc, etc… On a related note, if you tend to abuse alcohol and/or insulin resistant, be sure to also look into the insidious and often undiagnosed Thiamine (B1) deficiency which greatly affects glucose metabolism and electrolytes exchange for your nerve and muscle cells.

I suffered excruciating pain with kidney 5 mm stones in the ureter for a couple of months. Then I was told about ROWATINEX and bought it imediatamente. In a couple of days I had no pain whatsoever and I have never had again in the last 2 years after I took Rowatinex

Unfortunately, I started taking indapamide at the same time I started taking the rowatinex so it is possible that the indapamide has made the big difference but I don't think so. I think it is maybe a combo of the two or the rowatinex making the bigger difference of the two. I was taking lasik and the dr changed to indapamide instead to help not get kidney stones.When starting I had 5 stones in each kidney  biggest being 9mm. After a year taking 3 rowatinex twice a day and the indapamide, I went for exam and I had none in left kidney and several in right all 5mm or less. I have had totally different readings within a week of each other so it is alway hard to trust the competence of technicians. The 2nd year I went in and only had some tiny tiny stones. I decreased my rowitinex to 2 twice a day because it seemed alot I was taking and it is expensive. 3rd year, I was hoping for no sign of stones but there were several in right and one is 6mm. Did decrease in what I was taking in rowatinex make that difference? Not sure on that.My conclusion is that it must be helping, but it is not an instant acting fix for while you are passing a stone. Over the last 3 years I have had kidney stone pain and I chug water while constantly walking and pacing. The stone usually passed or subsided within an hour of doing this. Before starting  on rowatinex, I was having to have lithotripsy every 6 months to a year.I could stop taking it and only take the indapamide to test this but I don't want to risk getting enormous stones i can't pass to test this theory. Right now I will continue with regimen.I heard about rowatinex because a friend was in Germany and passed a stone and the hospital gave her the rowatinex to prevent stones. Dr.s I have went to have not heard of it, or don't acknowledge it because studies haven't been done to validate it in U.S.

I took these pills and I changed my diet a bit. Mainly trying to avoid processed foods as much as I can. I have never had kidney stones again. I think this has definitely helped.I have had kidney stone twice in the past and the second time it was only two years later after I had it for the first time. It was awful! It's now been over 4 years or so and no kidney stones again.I didn't want to review a product before knowing if it actually actually work. Now, several years later I can say that it has helped.I only took this medication for a short time. I believe about a bottle and I saved the second.
I know this item since 1959. It’s very effective to fight kidney stone.

I was skeptical, but after reading all the positive reviews here on Amazon, I decided to give this a try.  I had a 7x6x4mm stone stuck at the very bottom of my ureter.  I live in the middle of nowhere in the mountains of Guatemala, and the quality of medical care here is iffy at best.  It took them three months to even figure out what was wrong with me, but finally they got a good, clear scan and someone who could read it.  The doctor told me that since the ureter narrows at the junction with the bladder, it was highly unlikely I would ever pass this stone and was doing damage to my kidney by leaving it there.  He wanted to do a ureteroscopy, remove the stone, and put in a stent.  I'd heard awful things about those stents and wasn't too thrilled to get such an invasive procedure done down here in the boonies, so I put him off for weeks.  I heard about Rowatinex from a pharmacist here and decided to stop taking the Flomax (made me dizzy) and try this instead.  I took 2 pills Sunday night, 2 pills 3x on Monday, and passed the stone this morning before I even had a chance to take the pills.  Best part is that I passed it with zero pain!  In fact, if I hadn't been using a strainer, I wouldn't have even known I passed it.  I did not have any side effects at all.  It's pricy, but SO worth it!
column24: Better than: Flomax, Better than: surgery

column7: Rowintinex  came highly  recommended  by a friend. I had a 5.8 x 3.5 stone ,two months  later following  the directions ,the stone  had passed. I did have a breif pain and some nausea, in which  i took a prescribed  Percocet  accompanied  by prescribed  nausea  medication,which kicked in aprox 45 muns after taking. Did urinate  a couple of times with some strain,not pain and saw nothing. My educated  guess is the Stone had diminished  to particle. My freind that recommended Rowatinex  to me was pleased  to hear,and reminded  me he had seen with many others  the same outcome. So my advice is,its certainly  worth  a shot.

My mother has a small dog who has suffered with bladder stones her whole life. Since I'm the family vet tech, I took the little girl everywhere for assessment and suggestions. Diet, medicine, water changes...nothing worked very well and the stones would periodically recur. Also, often when we tested the urine we would get results of crystals in it. At some point, my mom went on an extended trip to Europe to visit relatives and saw a German vet there just for a checkup. The lady suggested this product. Since then, the little dog has had significantly decreased recurrence of crystals in her urine. Important: this product hasn't removed the urinary troubles completely, but it has worked in addition to all the other things we do for her (diet, low Ph water, occasional treatment) to keep the stones from actually forming. It DOES appear to be a useful supplement, but like anything else, I do not believe it is a miracle cure, and I do not know if drinking cranberry daily would have the same effect. However, you try to get a dog to drink cranberry juice (or me, for that matter)! This thing has worked as well as expected, and a bit better. Now, in all fairness, it works for a dog. I have to imagine it works for humans in the same fashion, when combined with sensible diet, but that's MY OWN assessment.
